import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_and_process_data():
    """Load and process the pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_millions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000
    
    # Separate USA and World data
    usa_data = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('United States', na=False)].copy()
    world_data = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('All countries', na=False)].copy()
    
    # Sort by date
    usa_data = usa_data.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    world_data = world_data.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    
    return df, usa_data, world_data

def calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate USA market share over time"""
    merged = pd.merge(usa_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      world_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      on='TIME_PERIOD', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    merged['usa_share'] = (merged['value_millions_usa'] / merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    return merged

def get_political_periods(data):
    """Define political periods for analysis"""
    periods = {
        'Pre-Trump (2002-2016)': data[data['year'] <= 2016],
        'Trump 1.0 (2017-2021)': data[(data['year'] >= 2017) & (data['year'] <= 2020)],
        'Biden (2021-2024)': data[(data['year'] >= 2021) & (data['year'] <= 2024)],
        'Trump 2.0 (2025+)': data[data['year'] >= 2025]
    }
    return periods

def calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate annual aggregated data"""
    usa_annual = usa_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    world_annual = world_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    
    annual_merged = pd.merge(usa_annual, world_annual, on='year', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    annual_merged['usa_share'] = (annual_merged['value_millions_usa'] / annual_merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    annual_merged['rest_world'] = annual_merged['value_millions_world'] - annual_merged['value_millions_usa']
    
    return annual_merged

def generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data):
    """Generate timeline comparison chart"""
    fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    # USA exports (left axis)
    ax1.plot(usa_data['TIME_PERIOD'], usa_data['value_millions'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5, label='USA Exports')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('USA Exports (€ millions)', color=USA_BLUE, fontsize=12)
    ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=USA_BLUE)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # World exports (right axis)
    ax2 = ax1.twinx()
    ax2.plot(world_data['TIME_PERIOD'], world_data['value_millions'], 
             color=ITALY_GREEN, linewidth=2.5, label='World Total Exports')
    ax2.set_ylabel('World Total Exports (€ millions)', color=ITALY_GREEN, fontsize=12)
    ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=ITALY_GREEN)
    
    # Mark political periods
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('Italian Pharmaceutical Exports: USA vs World Total\n(Monthly Data 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    
    # Combine legends
    lines1, labels1 = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
    lines2, labels2 = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
    ax1.legend(lines1 + lines2, labels1 + labels2, loc='upper left')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_timeline_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Timeline chart saved as 'official_timeline_chart.png'")

def generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data):
    """Generate USA market share evolution chart"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    plt.fill_between(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
                     alpha=0.3, color=USA_BLUE)
    plt.plot(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5)
    
    # Mark political periods
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('USA Share of Italian Pharmaceutical Exports\n(Monthly Data 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('USA Market Share (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend()
    
    # Add average line
    avg_share = market_share_data['usa_share'].mean()
    plt.axhline(y=avg_share, color=ITALY_RED, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7, 
                label=f'Average: {avg_share:.1f}%')
    plt.legend()
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_market_share_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share chart saved as 'official_market_share_chart.png'")

def generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data):
    """Generate annual growth rate comparison"""
    # Calculate growth rates
    annual_data['usa_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_usa'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['world_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_world'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['rest_world_growth'] = annual_data['rest_world'].pct_change() * 100
    
    # Filter for years with data
    growth_data = annual_data[annual_data['year'] >= 2003].copy()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    x = np.arange(len(growth_data))
    width = 0.25
    
    bars1 = ax.bar(x - width, growth_data['usa_growth'], width, 
                   label='USA', color=USA_BLUE, alpha=0.8)
    bars2 = ax.bar(x, growth_data['world_growth'], width, 
                   label='World Total', color=ITALY_GREEN, alpha=0.8)
    bars3 = ax.bar(x + width, growth_data['rest_world_growth'], width, 
                   label='Rest of World', color=ITALY_RED, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_ylabel('Annual Growth Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_title('Italian Pharmaceutical Export Growth Rates\n(Year-over-Year % Change)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(growth_data['year'], rotation=45)
    ax.legend()
    ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_growth_comparison_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth comparison chart saved as 'official_growth_comparison_chart.png'")

def generate_political_periods_chart(usa_data):
    """Generate market dependency by political periods"""
    periods = get_political_periods(usa_data)
    
    # Calculate averages for each period
    period_stats = {}
    for period_name, period_data in periods.items():
        if not period_data.empty:
            avg_value = period_data['value_millions'].mean()
            period_stats[period_name] = avg_value
    
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(16, 8))
    
    # Pie chart of average monthly exports by period
    sizes = list(period_stats.values())
    labels = list(period_stats.keys())
    colors = [ITALY_GREEN, ITALY_RED, USA_BLUE, '#FF6B35']
    
    wedges, texts, autotexts = ax1.pie(sizes, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', 
                                       colors=colors, startangle=90)
    ax1.set_title('Average Monthly USA Exports by Political Period\n(€ millions)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    
    # Bar chart comparison
    bars = ax2.bar(range(len(period_stats)), sizes, color=colors, alpha=0.8)
    ax2.set_xlabel('Political Period', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_ylabel('Average Monthly Exports (€ millions)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_title('USA Export Performance by Administration', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax2.set_xticks(range(len(labels)))
    ax2.set_xticklabels(labels, rotation=45, ha='right')
    ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    
    # Add value labels on bars
    for bar, value in zip(bars, sizes):
        height = bar.get_height()
        ax2.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height + height*0.01,
                f'€{value:.0f}M', ha='center', va='bottom', fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_political_periods_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Political periods chart saved as 'official_political_periods_chart.png'")

def generate_tariff_scenario_chart(usa_data):
    """Generate tariff impact scenario modeling"""
    # Use recent average (2020-2024) as baseline
    recent_data = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]
    baseline_monthly = recent_data['value_millions'].mean()

    # Tariff scenarios
    tariff_rates = [0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30]

    impact_scenarios = [baseline_annual * (1 - (rate * 0.005)) for rate in tariff_rates]
    revenue_loss = [baseline_annual - scenario for scenario in impact_scenarios]
    
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(16, 8))
    
    # Scenario projections
    ax1.plot(tariff_rates, impact_scenarios, 'o-', color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=3, markersize=8)
    ax1.axhline(y=baseline_annual, color=ITALY_GREEN, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7,

    ax1.set_xlabel('Tariff Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('Projected Annual Exports (€ billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_title('USA Export Projections Under Different Tariff Scenarios',

    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)

    ax2.set_xlabel('Tariff Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_ylabel('Annual Revenue Loss (€ billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_title('Potential Revenue Loss from US Tariffs', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    
    # Add value labels
    for bar, loss in zip(bars, revenue_loss[1:]):
        height = bar.get_height()
        ax2.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height + height*0.02,
                f'€{loss/1000:.1f}B', ha='center', va='bottom', fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_tariff_scenarios_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Tariff scenarios chart saved as 'official_tariff_scenarios_chart.png'")

def generate_monthly_heatmap(usa_data):

    # Create pivot table for heatmap
    heatmap_data = usa_data.pivot_table(values='value_millions', 
                                        index='year',

                        fontsize=8, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_monthly_heatmap.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Monthly heatmap saved as 'official_monthly_heatmap.png'")

def print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data):
    """Print key statistics for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("KEY STATISTICS FOR PRESENTATION")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Current market size
    recent_usa = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    recent_world = world_data[world_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    usa_share_recent = (recent_usa / recent_world) * 100
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SIZE (2020-2024 Average):")
    print(f"   • USA Market: €{recent_usa:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • World Total: €{recent_world:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • USA Share: {usa_share_recent:.1f}% of total Italian pharma exports")
    
    # Growth trends
    growth_2019_2024_usa = ((usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                            usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    growth_2019_2024_world = ((world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                              world_data[world_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    
    print(f"\nGROWTH TRENDS (2019-2024):")
    print(f"   • USA Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_usa:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • World Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_world:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • USA outpacing world by: {growth_2019_2024_usa - growth_2019_2024_world:.1f} percentage points")
    
    # Political period analysis
    trump1_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2017) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2020)]['value_millions'].mean()
    biden_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2021) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2024)]['value_millions'].mean()
    
    print(f"\nPOLITICAL PERIOD COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Trump 1.0 (2017-2020): €{trump1_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden (2021-2024): €{biden_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden era growth: +{((biden_avg/trump1_avg)-1)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Risk assessment
    max_monthly = usa_data['value_millions'].max()
    volatility = usa_data['value_millions'].std()
    
    print(f"\nRISK FACTORS:")
    print(f"   • Peak monthly export: €{max_monthly:.0f}M")
    print(f"   • Monthly volatility: ±€{volatility:.0f}M (std dev)")
    print(f"   • At 10% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.1:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    print(f"   • At 20% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.2:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    
    print(f"\nKEY INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • USA is Italy's {usa_share_recent:.0f}% pharmaceutical export market")
    print(f"   • Strong growth momentum even during political uncertainty")
    print(f"   • High absolute values mean significant revenue exposure to policy changes")
    print(f"   • Seasonal patterns suggest consistent pharmaceutical demand")
    
    print("\n" + "="*60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading and processing Italian pharmaceutical export data...")
    
    # Load data
    df, usa_data, world_data = load_and_process_data()
    market_share_data = calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data)
    annual_data = calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records from {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating visualizations...")
    
    generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data)
    generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data)
    generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data)
    generate_political_periods_chart(usa_data)
    generate_tariff_scenario_chart(usa_data)
    generate_monthly_heatmap(usa_data)
    
    # Print statistics
    print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data)
    
    print("\nAll visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • official_timeline_chart.png")
    print("   • official_market_share_chart.png") 
    print("   • official_growth_comparison_chart.png")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_and_process_data():
    """Load and process the pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_millions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000
    
    # Separate USA and World data
    usa_data = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('United States', na=False)].copy()
    world_data = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('All countries', na=False)].copy()
    
    # Sort by date
    usa_data = usa_data.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    world_data = world_data.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    
    return df, usa_data, world_data

def calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate USA market share over time"""
    merged = pd.merge(usa_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      world_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      on='TIME_PERIOD', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    merged['usa_share'] = (merged['value_millions_usa'] / merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    return merged


def calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate annual aggregated data"""
    usa_annual = usa_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    world_annual = world_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    
    annual_merged = pd.merge(usa_annual, world_annual, on='year', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    annual_merged['usa_share'] = (annual_merged['value_millions_usa'] / annual_merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    annual_merged['rest_world'] = annual_merged['value_millions_world'] - annual_merged['value_millions_usa']
    
    return annual_merged

def generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data):
    """Generate timeline comparison chart"""
    fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    # USA exports (left axis)
    ax1.plot(usa_data['TIME_PERIOD'], usa_data['value_millions'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5, label='USA Exports')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('USA Exports (€ millions)', color=USA_BLUE, fontsize=12)
    ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=USA_BLUE)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # World exports (right axis)
    ax2 = ax1.twinx()
    ax2.plot(world_data['TIME_PERIOD'], world_data['value_millions'], 
             color=ITALY_GREEN, linewidth=2.5, label='World Total Exports')
    ax2.set_ylabel('World Total Exports (€ millions)', color=ITALY_GREEN, fontsize=12)
    ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=ITALY_GREEN)
    
    # Mark political periods
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('Italian Pharmaceutical Exports: USA vs World Total\n(Monthly Data 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    
    # Combine legends
    lines1, labels1 = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
    lines2, labels2 = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
    ax1.legend(lines1 + lines2, labels1 + labels2, loc='upper left')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_timeline_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Timeline chart saved as 'official_timeline_chart.png'")

def generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data):
    """Generate USA market share evolution chart"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    plt.fill_between(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
                     alpha=0.3, color=USA_BLUE)
    plt.plot(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5)
    
    # Mark political periods
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('USA Share of Italian Pharmaceutical Exports\n(Monthly Data 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('USA Market Share (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend()
    
    # Add average line
    avg_share = market_share_data['usa_share'].mean()
    plt.axhline(y=avg_share, color=ITALY_RED, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7, 
                label=f'Average: {avg_share:.1f}%')
    plt.legend()
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_market_share_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share chart saved as 'official_market_share_chart.png'")

def generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data):
    """Generate annual growth rate comparison"""
    # Calculate growth rates
    annual_data['usa_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_usa'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['world_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_world'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['rest_world_growth'] = annual_data['rest_world'].pct_change() * 100
    
    # Filter for years with data
    growth_data = annual_data[annual_data['year'] >= 2003].copy()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    x = np.arange(len(growth_data))
    width = 0.25
    
    bars1 = ax.bar(x - width, growth_data['usa_growth'], width, 
                   label='USA', color=USA_BLUE, alpha=0.8)
    bars2 = ax.bar(x, growth_data['world_growth'], width, 
                   label='World Total', color=ITALY_GREEN, alpha=0.8)
    bars3 = ax.bar(x + width, growth_data['rest_world_growth'], width, 
                   label='Rest of World', color=ITALY_RED, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_ylabel('Annual Growth Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_title('Italian Pharmaceutical Export Growth Rates\n(Year-over-Year % Change)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(growth_data['year'], rotation=45)
    ax.legend()
    ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('official_growth_comparison_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth comparison chart saved as 'official_growth_comparison_chart.png'")




def print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data):
    """Print key statistics for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("KEY STATISTICS FOR PRESENTATION")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Current market size
    recent_usa = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    recent_world = world_data[world_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    usa_share_recent = (recent_usa / recent_world) * 100
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SIZE (2020-2024 Average):")
    print(f"   • USA Market: €{recent_usa:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • World Total: €{recent_world:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • USA Share: {usa_share_recent:.1f}% of total Italian pharma exports")
    
    # Growth trends
    growth_2019_2024_usa = ((usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                            usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    growth_2019_2024_world = ((world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                              world_data[world_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    
    print(f"\nGROWTH TRENDS (2019-2024):")
    print(f"   • USA Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_usa:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • World Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_world:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • USA outpacing world by: {growth_2019_2024_usa - growth_2019_2024_world:.1f} percentage points")
    
    # Political period analysis
    trump1_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2017) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2020)]['value_millions'].mean()
    biden_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2021) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2024)]['value_millions'].mean()
    
    print(f"\nPOLITICAL PERIOD COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Trump 1.0 (2017-2020): €{trump1_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden (2021-2024): €{biden_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden era growth: +{((biden_avg/trump1_avg)-1)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Risk assessment
    max_monthly = usa_data['value_millions'].max()
    volatility = usa_data['value_millions'].std()
    
    print(f"\nRISK FACTORS:")
    print(f"   • Peak monthly export: €{max_monthly:.0f}M")
    print(f"   • Monthly volatility: ±€{volatility:.0f}M (std dev)")
    print(f"   • At 10% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.1:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    print(f"   • At 20% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.2:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    
    print(f"\nKEY INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • USA is Italy's {usa_share_recent:.0f}% pharmaceutical export market")
    print(f"   • Strong growth momentum even during political uncertainty")
    print(f"   • High absolute values mean significant revenue exposure to policy changes")
    print(f"   • Seasonal patterns suggest consistent pharmaceutical demand")
    
    print("\n" + "="*60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading and processing Italian pharmaceutical export data...")
    
    # Load data
    df, usa_data, world_data = load_and_process_data()
    market_share_data = calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data)
    annual_data = calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records from {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating visualizations...")
    
    generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data)
    generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data)
    generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data)
    
    # Print statistics
    print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data)
    
    print("\nAll visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • official_timeline_chart.png")
    print("   • official_market_share_chart.png") 
    print("   • official_growth_comparison_chart.png")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'
SECTOR_COLORS = ['#009246', '#CE2B37', '#002868', '#FF6B35', '#8B4513', '#4B0082', '#228B22', '#DC143C', '#00008B', '#B8860B']

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (14, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_multi_sector_data():
    """Load and process the multi-sector pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_pharma_plus_other_sectors.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_billions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000_000
    
    # Clean product names for better display
    sector_mapping = {
        '0': 'Food & Live Animals',
        '1': 'Beverages & Tobacco',
        '5': 'Chemicals & Related',
        '7': 'Machinery & Transport',
        '11': 'Beverages',
        '54': 'Pharmaceuticals',
        '65': 'Textiles',
        '78': 'Road Vehicles',
        '79': 'Other Transport Equipment',
        '84': 'Apparel & Clothing'
    }
    
    df['sector_name'] = df['PRODUCT'].map(sector_mapping)
    
    return df

def calculate_sector_statistics(df):
    """Calculate key statistics for each sector"""
    # Recent performance (2020-2025)
    recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020].copy()
    
    sector_stats = []
    for sector in df['PRODUCT'].unique():
        sector_data = df[df['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        recent_sector = recent_data[recent_data['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        
        # Calculate metrics
        total_recent = recent_sector['value_billions'].sum()
        avg_monthly = recent_sector['value_billions'].mean()
        volatility = recent_sector['value_billions'].std() / avg_monthly * 100 if avg_monthly > 0 else 0
        
        # Growth calculation (2020 vs 2024)
        if len(sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2020]) > 0 and len(sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2024]) > 0:
            value_2020 = sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2020]['value_billions'].sum()
            value_2024 = sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2024]['value_billions'].sum()
            growth_rate = ((value_2024 / value_2020) - 1) * 100 if value_2020 > 0 else 0
        else:
            growth_rate = 0
        
        sector_stats.append({
            'sector': sector,
            'sector_name': df[df['PRODUCT'] == sector]['sector_name'].iloc[0],
            'total_recent': total_recent,
            'avg_monthly': avg_monthly,
            'volatility': volatility,
            'growth_rate': growth_rate
        })
    
    return pd.DataFrame(sector_stats).sort_values('total_recent', ascending=False)

def generate_market_share_dashboard(df):
    """Generate market share evolution dashboard for top 5 sectors"""
    # Get top 5 sectors by recent volume
    recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020]
    top_sectors = recent_data.groupby('PRODUCT')['value_billions'].sum().nlargest(5).index
    
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18, 8))
    
    # Timeline evolution
    for i, sector in enumerate(top_sectors):
        sector_data = df[df['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        sector_annual = sector_data.groupby('year')['value_billions'].sum()
        sector_name = df[df['PRODUCT'] == sector]['sector_name'].iloc[0]
        
        ax1.plot(sector_annual.index, sector_annual.values, 
                label=sector_name, linewidth=2.5, color=SECTOR_COLORS[i])
    
    ax1.set_title('Italian Export Evolution to USA by Sector\n(Annual Totals 2002-2025)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('Export Value (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    ax1.legend(loc='upper left')
    
    # Market share pie chart (2020-2025 average)
    recent_totals = recent_data.groupby(['PRODUCT', 'sector_name'])['value_billions'].sum().reset_index()
    recent_totals = recent_totals.sort_values('value_billions', ascending=False)
    
    # Top 5 + Others
    top_5_sectors = recent_totals.head(5)
    others_total = recent_totals.tail(len(recent_totals)-5)['value_billions'].sum()
    
    sizes = list(top_5_sectors['value_billions']) + [others_total]
    labels = list(top_5_sectors['sector_name']) + ['Others']
    colors = SECTOR_COLORS[:len(sizes)]
    
    wedges, texts, autotexts = ax2.pie(sizes, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', 
                                       colors=colors, startangle=90)
    ax2.set_title('Market Share by Sector\n(2020-2025 Average)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share dashboard saved as 'plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png'")

def generate_strategic_positioning_matrix(sector_stats):
    """Generate growth vs volatility matrix"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 10))
    
    # Create scatter plot
    for i, row in sector_stats.iterrows():
        size = row['total_recent'] * 100  # Bubble size proportional to export value
        plt.scatter(row['volatility'], row['growth_rate'], 
                   s=size, alpha=0.7, color=SECTOR_COLORS[i % len(SECTOR_COLORS)],
                   label=row['sector_name'], edgecolors='black', linewidth=1)
        
        # Add sector labels
        plt.annotate(row['sector_name'], 
                    (row['volatility'], row['growth_rate']),
                    xytext=(5, 5), textcoords='offset points',
                    fontsize=10, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5)
    plt.axvline(x=sector_stats['volatility'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, 
                label=f'Avg Volatility: {sector_stats["volatility"].mean():.1f}%')
    
    plt.xlabel('Volatility (Coefficient of Variation %)', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('Growth Rate 2020-2024 (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.title('Italian Export Sectors: Strategic Positioning Matrix\n(Bubble size = Export Volume)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc='upper left')
    
    # Add quadrant labels
    plt.text(sector_stats['volatility'].max() * 0.9, sector_stats['growth_rate'].max() * 0.9,
             'High Growth\nHigh Risk', ha='center', va='center', 
             bbox=dict(boxstyle='round', facecolor='lightblue', alpha=0.7))
    plt.text(sector_stats['volatility'].min() * 1.1, sector_stats['growth_rate'].max() * 0.9,
             'High Growth\nLow Risk', ha='center', va='center',
             bbox=dict(boxstyle='round', facecolor='lightgreen', alpha=0.7))
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Strategic positioning matrix saved as 'plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png'")

def generate_sector_ranking_chart(sector_stats):
    """Generate sector size comparison chart"""
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18, 8))
    
    # Export volume ranking
    sorted_stats = sector_stats.sort_values('total_recent', ascending=True)
    
    bars1 = ax1.barh(range(len(sorted_stats)), sorted_stats['total_recent'], 
                     color=[SECTOR_COLORS[i % len(SECTOR_COLORS)] for i in range(len(sorted_stats))],
                     alpha=0.8)
    
    ax1.set_yticks(range(len(sorted_stats)))
    ax1.set_yticklabels(sorted_stats['sector_name'])
    ax1.set_xlabel('Total Export Value 2020-2025 (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_title('Italian Export Sectors to USA - Volume Ranking', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    
    # Add value labels
    for i, bar in enumerate(bars1):
        width = bar.get_width()
        ax1.text(width + width*0.01, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2.,
                f'EUR{width:.1f}B', ha='left', va='center', fontweight='bold')
    
    # Growth rate comparison
    sorted_growth = sector_stats.sort_values('growth_rate', ascending=True)
    colors_growth = ['red' if x < 0 else 'green' for x in sorted_growth['growth_rate']]
    
    bars2 = ax2.barh(range(len(sorted_growth)), sorted_growth['growth_rate'], 
                     color=colors_growth, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax2.set_yticks(range(len(sorted_growth)))
    ax2.set_yticklabels(sorted_growth['sector_name'])
    ax2.set_xlabel('Growth Rate 2020-2024 (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_title('Sector Growth Performance', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    ax2.axvline(x=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    # Add value labels
    for i, bar in enumerate(bars2):
        width = bar.get_width()
        x_pos = width + (1 if width >= 0 else -1)
        ax2.text(x_pos, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2.,
                f'{width:.1f}%', ha='left' if width >= 0 else 'right', va='center', fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/sector_ranking_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Sector ranking chart saved as 'plots/sector_ranking_chart.png'")

def generate_pharma_context_analysis(df, sector_stats):
    """Generate analysis showing pharmaceuticals in context of chemical cluster"""
    # Focus on pharmaceuticals vs related sectors
    chemical_sectors = ['5', '54']  # Chemicals and Pharmaceuticals
    related_data = df[df['PRODUCT'].isin(chemical_sectors)].copy()
    
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18, 8))
    
    # Chemical cluster evolution
    for sector in chemical_sectors:
        sector_data = related_data[related_data['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        annual_data = sector_data.groupby('year')['value_billions'].sum()
        sector_name = sector_data['sector_name'].iloc[0]
        
        color = ITALY_RED if sector == '54' else ITALY_GREEN
        ax1.plot(annual_data.index, annual_data.values, 
                label=sector_name, linewidth=3, color=color)
    
    ax1.set_title('Italian Chemical Cluster Exports to USA\n(Pharmaceuticals vs Broader Chemicals)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('Export Value (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    ax1.legend()
    
    # Pharmaceutical position in overall ranking
    pharma_stats = sector_stats[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].iloc[0]
    pharma_rank = sector_stats.reset_index().index[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].tolist()[0] + 1
    
    # Create ranking visualization
    y_pos = range(len(sector_stats))
    bars = ax2.barh(y_pos, sector_stats['total_recent'])
    
    # Highlight pharmaceuticals
    for i, (idx, row) in enumerate(sector_stats.iterrows()):
        if row['sector'] == '54':
            bars[i].set_color(ITALY_RED)
            bars[i].set_alpha(0.9)
        else:
            bars[i].set_color(ITALY_GREEN)
            bars[i].set_alpha(0.6)
    
    ax2.set_yticks(y_pos)
    ax2.set_yticklabels(sector_stats['sector_name'])
    ax2.set_xlabel('Total Export Value 2020-2025 (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_title(f'Pharmaceuticals Ranking: #{pharma_rank} of {len(sector_stats)} Sectors', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    
    # Add pharmaceutical highlight
    ax2.text(pharma_stats['total_recent'] + 5, pharma_rank-1, 
             f'EUR{pharma_stats["total_recent"]:.1f}B\n({pharma_stats["growth_rate"]:.1f}% growth)',
             ha='left', va='center', fontweight='bold', 
             bbox=dict(boxstyle='round', facecolor='yellow', alpha=0.7))
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/pharma_context_analysis.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Pharmaceutical context analysis saved as 'plots/pharma_context_analysis.png'")

def generate_resilience_comparison(df):
    """Compare sector resilience during crisis periods"""
    # Define crisis periods
    crisis_periods = {
        '2008 Financial Crisis': (2008, 2009),
        'COVID-19 Pandemic': (2020, 2021),
        'Recent Decline': (2023, 2024)
    }
    
    # Focus on top 5 sectors
    recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020]
    top_sectors = recent_data.groupby('PRODUCT')['value_billions'].sum().nlargest(5).index
    
    fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, len(crisis_periods), figsize=(20, 6))
    
    for idx, (period_name, (start_year, end_year)) in enumerate(crisis_periods.items()):
        period_data = df[(df['year'] >= start_year) & (df['year'] <= end_year)]
        
        sector_performance = []
        sector_names = []
        
        for sector in top_sectors:
            sector_data = period_data[period_data['PRODUCT'] == sector]
            if len(sector_data) > 0:
                # Calculate average monthly performance
                avg_performance = sector_data['value_billions'].mean()
                sector_performance.append(avg_performance)
                sector_names.append(sector_data['sector_name'].iloc[0])
        
        colors = [ITALY_RED if 'Pharmaceuticals' in name else ITALY_GREEN for name in sector_names]
        bars = axes[idx].bar(range(len(sector_performance)), sector_performance, 
                            color=colors, alpha=0.8)
        
        axes[idx].set_title(f'{period_name}\n({start_year}-{end_year})', 
                           fontsize=12, fontweight='bold')
        axes[idx].set_xticks(range(len(sector_names)))
        axes[idx].set_xticklabels(sector_names, rotation=45, ha='right')
        axes[idx].set_ylabel('Avg Monthly Exports (EUR billions)', fontsize=10)
        axes[idx].grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
        
        # Highlight pharmaceutical performance
        for i, (bar, name) in enumerate(zip(bars, sector_names)):
            if 'Pharmaceuticals' in name:
                height = bar.get_height()
                axes[idx].text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height + height*0.05,
                              f'EUR{height:.2f}B', ha='center', va='bottom', 
                              fontweight='bold', color='red')
    
    plt.suptitle('Sector Resilience During Crisis Periods\n(Red = Pharmaceuticals, Green = Other Sectors)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', y=1.05)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/resilience_comparison.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Resilience comparison saved as 'plots/resilience_comparison.png'")

def print_multi_sector_insights(sector_stats, df):
    """Print key insights for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*70)
    print("MULTI-SECTOR ANALYSIS - KEY INSIGHTS")
    print("="*70)
    
    pharma_stats = sector_stats[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].iloc[0]
    pharma_rank = sector_stats.reset_index().index[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].tolist()[0] + 1
    
    print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL SECTOR POSITION:")
    print(f"   • Ranking: #{pharma_rank} of {len(sector_stats)} major export sectors")
    print(f"   • Market Size: EUR{pharma_stats['total_recent']:.1f}B (2020-2025)")
    print(f"   • Growth Rate: {pharma_stats['growth_rate']:.1f}% (2020-2024)")
    print(f"   • Volatility: {pharma_stats['volatility']:.1f}% (highest among all sectors)")
    
    # Top 3 sectors
    top_3 = sector_stats.head(3)
    print(f"\nTOP 3 ITALIAN EXPORT SECTORS TO USA:")
    for i, (_, row) in enumerate(top_3.iterrows(), 1):
        print(f"   {i}. {row['sector_name']}: EUR{row['total_recent']:.1f}B ({row['growth_rate']:.1f}% growth)")
    
    # Chemical cluster context
    chemical_total = sector_stats[sector_stats['sector'].isin(['5', '54'])]['total_recent'].sum()
    print(f"\nCHEMICAL CLUSTER ANALYSIS:")
    print(f"   • Combined Chemicals + Pharmaceuticals: EUR{chemical_total:.1f}B")
    print(f"   • Pharmaceuticals share of chemical cluster: {(pharma_stats['total_recent']/chemical_total)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Strategic insights
    high_growth_sectors = sector_stats[sector_stats['growth_rate'] > 0]
    print(f"\nSTRATEGIC INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • {len(high_growth_sectors)} of {len(sector_stats)} sectors showing positive growth")
    print(f"   • Pharmaceuticals represent 'high-risk, high-reward' positioning")
    print(f"   • Most volatile sector but part of critical healthcare supply chain")
    print(f"   • Differs from traditional Italian exports (fashion, food, machinery)")
    
    print("\n" + "="*70)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading multi-sector Italian export data...")
    
    # Load and analyze data
    df = load_multi_sector_data()
    sector_stats = calculate_sector_statistics(df)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records covering {len(df['PRODUCT'].unique())} sectors")
    print(f"Time period: {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating multi-sector comparative visualizations...")
    
    generate_market_share_dashboard(df)
    generate_strategic_positioning_matrix(sector_stats)
    generate_sector_ranking_chart(sector_stats)
    generate_pharma_context_analysis(df, sector_stats)
    generate_resilience_comparison(df)
    
    # Print insights
    print_multi_sector_insights(sector_stats, df)
    
    print("\nAll multi-sector visualizations completed!")
    print("New files created:")
    print("   • plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png")
    print("   • plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png") 
    print("   • plots/sector_ranking_chart.png")
    print("   • plots/pharma_context_analysis.png")
    print("   • plots/resilience_comparison.png")

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

from datetime import datetime

        '0': 'Food & Live Animals',

    df['sector_name'] = df['PRODUCT'].map(sector_mapping)
    
    return df

def calculate_sector_statistics(df):
    """Calculate key statistics for each sector"""
    # Recent performance (2020-2025)
    recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020].copy()
    
    sector_stats = []
    for sector in df['PRODUCT'].unique():
        sector_data = df[df['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        recent_sector = recent_data[recent_data['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        
        # Calculate metrics
        total_recent = recent_sector['value_billions'].sum()
        avg_monthly = recent_sector['value_billions'].mean()
        volatility = recent_sector['value_billions'].std() / avg_monthly * 100 if avg_monthly > 0 else 0
        
        # Growth calculation (2020 vs 2024)
        if len(sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2020]) > 0 and len(sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2024]) > 0:
            value_2020 = sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2020]['value_billions'].sum()

            'sector': sector,

        })

    recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020]

    for i, sector in enumerate(top_sectors):
        sector_data = df[df['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()

        ax1.plot(sector_annual.index, sector_annual.values, 
                label=sector_name, linewidth=2.5, color=SECTOR_COLORS[i])
    
    ax1.set_title('Italian Export Evolution to USA by Sector\n(Annual Totals 2002-2025)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('Export Value (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    ax1.legend(loc='upper left')
    
    # Market share pie chart (2020-2025 average)
    recent_totals = recent_data.groupby(['PRODUCT', 'sector_name'])['value_billions'].sum().reset_index()
    recent_totals = recent_totals.sort_values('value_billions', ascending=False)
    
    # Top 5 + Others
    top_5_sectors = recent_totals.head(5)
    others_total = recent_totals.tail(len(recent_totals)-5)['value_billions'].sum()
    
    sizes = list(top_5_sectors['value_billions']) + [others_total]
    labels = list(top_5_sectors['sector_name']) + ['Others']
    colors = SECTOR_COLORS[:len(sizes)]
    
    wedges, texts, autotexts = ax2.pie(sizes, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', 
                                       colors=colors, startangle=90)
    ax2.set_title('Market Share by Sector\n(2020-2025 Average)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share dashboard saved as 'plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png'")

def generate_strategic_positioning_matrix(sector_stats):
    """Generate growth vs volatility matrix"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 10))
    
    # Create scatter plot
    for i, row in sector_stats.iterrows():
        size = row['total_recent'] * 100  # Bubble size proportional to export value
        plt.scatter(row['volatility'], row['growth_rate'], 
                   s=size, alpha=0.7, color=SECTOR_COLORS[i % len(SECTOR_COLORS)],
                   label=row['sector_name'], edgecolors='black', linewidth=1)
        
        # Add sector labels
        plt.annotate(row['sector_name'], 
                    (row['volatility'], row['growth_rate']),
                    xytext=(5, 5), textcoords='offset points',
                    fontsize=10, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5)
    plt.axvline(x=sector_stats['volatility'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='--', alpha=0.5, 
                label=f'Avg Volatility: {sector_stats["volatility"].mean():.1f}%')
    
    plt.xlabel('Volatility (Coefficient of Variation %)', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('Growth Rate 2020-2024 (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.title('Italian Export Sectors: Strategic Positioning Matrix\n(Bubble size = Export Volume)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc='upper left')
    
    # Add quadrant labels
    plt.text(sector_stats['volatility'].max() * 0.9, sector_stats['growth_rate'].max() * 0.9,
             'High Growth\nHigh Risk', ha='center', va='center', 
             bbox=dict(boxstyle='round', facecolor='lightblue', alpha=0.7))
    plt.text(sector_stats['volatility'].min() * 1.1, sector_stats['growth_rate'].max() * 0.9,
             'High Growth\nLow Risk', ha='center', va='center',
             bbox=dict(boxstyle='round', facecolor='lightgreen', alpha=0.7))
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Strategic positioning matrix saved as 'plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png'")

def generate_sector_ranking_chart(sector_stats):
    """Generate sector size comparison chart"""
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18, 8))
    
    # Export volume ranking
    sorted_stats = sector_stats.sort_values('total_recent', ascending=True)
    
    bars1 = ax1.barh(range(len(sorted_stats)), sorted_stats['total_recent'], 
                     color=[SECTOR_COLORS[i % len(SECTOR_COLORS)] for i in range(len(sorted_stats))],
                     alpha=0.8)
    
    ax1.set_yticks(range(len(sorted_stats)))
    ax1.set_yticklabels(sorted_stats['sector_name'])
    ax1.set_xlabel('Total Export Value 2020-2025 (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_title('Italian Export Sectors to USA - Volume Ranking', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    
    # Add value labels
    for i, bar in enumerate(bars1):
        width = bar.get_width()
        ax1.text(width + width*0.01, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2.,
                f'EUR{width:.1f}B', ha='left', va='center', fontweight='bold')
    
    # Growth rate comparison
    sorted_growth = sector_stats.sort_values('growth_rate', ascending=True)
    colors_growth = ['red' if x < 0 else 'green' for x in sorted_growth['growth_rate']]
    
    bars2 = ax2.barh(range(len(sorted_growth)), sorted_growth['growth_rate'], 
                     color=colors_growth, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax2.set_yticks(range(len(sorted_growth)))
    ax2.set_yticklabels(sorted_growth['sector_name'])
    ax2.set_xlabel('Growth Rate 2020-2024 (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_title('Sector Growth Performance', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    ax2.axvline(x=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    # Add value labels
    for i, bar in enumerate(bars2):
        width = bar.get_width()
        x_pos = width + (1 if width >= 0 else -1)
        ax2.text(x_pos, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2.,
                f'{width:.1f}%', ha='left' if width >= 0 else 'right', va='center', fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/sector_ranking_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Sector ranking chart saved as 'plots/sector_ranking_chart.png'")

def generate_pharma_context_analysis(df, sector_stats):
    """Generate analysis showing pharmaceuticals in context of chemical cluster"""
    # Focus on pharmaceuticals vs related sectors
    chemical_sectors = ['5', '54']  # Chemicals and Pharmaceuticals
    related_data = df[df['PRODUCT'].isin(chemical_sectors)].copy()
    
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18, 8))
    
    # Chemical cluster evolution
    for sector in chemical_sectors:
        sector_data = related_data[related_data['PRODUCT'] == sector].copy()
        annual_data = sector_data.groupby('year')['value_billions'].sum()
        sector_name = sector_data['sector_name'].iloc[0]
        
        color = ITALY_RED if sector == '54' else ITALY_GREEN
        ax1.plot(annual_data.index, annual_data.values, 
                label=sector_name, linewidth=3, color=color)
    
    ax1.set_title('Italian Chemical Cluster Exports to USA\n(Pharmaceuticals vs Broader Chemicals)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('Export Value (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    ax1.legend()
    
    # Pharmaceutical position in overall ranking
    pharma_stats = sector_stats[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].iloc[0]
    pharma_rank = sector_stats.reset_index().index[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].tolist()[0] + 1
    
    # Create ranking visualization
    y_pos = range(len(sector_stats))
    bars = ax2.barh(y_pos, sector_stats['total_recent'])
    
    # Highlight pharmaceuticals
    for i, (idx, row) in enumerate(sector_stats.iterrows()):
        if row['sector'] == '54':
            bars[i].set_color(ITALY_RED)
            bars[i].set_alpha(0.9)
        else:
            bars[i].set_color(ITALY_GREEN)
            bars[i].set_alpha(0.6)
    
    ax2.set_yticks(y_pos)
    ax2.set_yticklabels(sector_stats['sector_name'])
    ax2.set_xlabel('Total Export Value 2020-2025 (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax2.set_title(f'Pharmaceuticals Ranking: #{pharma_rank} of {len(sector_stats)} Sectors', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax2.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    
    # Add pharmaceutical highlight
    ax2.text(pharma_stats['total_recent'] + 5, pharma_rank-1, 
             f'EUR{pharma_stats["total_recent"]:.1f}B\n({pharma_stats["growth_rate"]:.1f}% growth)',
             ha='left', va='center', fontweight='bold', 
             bbox=dict(boxstyle='round', facecolor='yellow', alpha=0.7))
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/pharma_context_analysis.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Pharmaceutical context analysis saved as 'plots/pharma_context_analysis.png'")

def generate_resilience_comparison(df):
    """Compare sector resilience during crisis periods"""
    # Define crisis periods
    crisis_periods = {
        '2008 Financial Crisis': (2008, 2009),
        'COVID-19 Pandemic': (2020, 2021),
        'Recent Decline': (2023, 2024)
    }
    
    # Focus on top 5 sectors
    recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020]
    top_sectors = recent_data.groupby('PRODUCT')['value_billions'].sum().nlargest(5).index
    
    fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, len(crisis_periods), figsize=(20, 6))
    
    for idx, (period_name, (start_year, end_year)) in enumerate(crisis_periods.items()):
        period_data = df[(df['year'] >= start_year) & (df['year'] <= end_year)]
        
        sector_performance = []
        sector_names = []
        
        for sector in top_sectors:
            sector_data = period_data[period_data['PRODUCT'] == sector]
            if len(sector_data) > 0:
                # Calculate average monthly performance
                avg_performance = sector_data['value_billions'].mean()
                sector_performance.append(avg_performance)
                sector_names.append(sector_data['sector_name'].iloc[0])
        
        colors = [ITALY_RED if 'Pharmaceuticals' in name else ITALY_GREEN for name in sector_names]
        bars = axes[idx].bar(range(len(sector_performance)), sector_performance, 
                            color=colors, alpha=0.8)
        
        axes[idx].set_title(f'{period_name}\n({start_year}-{end_year})', 
                           fontsize=12, fontweight='bold')
        axes[idx].set_xticks(range(len(sector_names)))
        axes[idx].set_xticklabels(sector_names, rotation=45, ha='right')
        axes[idx].set_ylabel('Avg Monthly Exports (EUR billions)', fontsize=10)
        axes[idx].grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
        
        # Highlight pharmaceutical performance
        for i, (bar, name) in enumerate(zip(bars, sector_names)):
            if 'Pharmaceuticals' in name:
                height = bar.get_height()
                axes[idx].text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height + height*0.05,
                              f'EUR{height:.2f}B', ha='center', va='bottom', 
                              fontweight='bold', color='red')
    
    plt.suptitle('Sector Resilience During Crisis Periods\n(Red = Pharmaceuticals, Green = Other Sectors)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', y=1.05)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/resilience_comparison.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Resilience comparison saved as 'plots/resilience_comparison.png'")

def print_multi_sector_insights(sector_stats, df):
    """Print key insights for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*70)
    print("MULTI-SECTOR ANALYSIS - KEY INSIGHTS")
    print("="*70)
    
    pharma_stats = sector_stats[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].iloc[0]
    pharma_rank = sector_stats.reset_index().index[sector_stats['sector'] == '54'].tolist()[0] + 1
    
    print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL SECTOR POSITION:")
    print(f"   • Ranking: #{pharma_rank} of {len(sector_stats)} major export sectors")
    print(f"   • Market Size: EUR{pharma_stats['total_recent']:.1f}B (2020-2025)")
    print(f"   • Growth Rate: {pharma_stats['growth_rate']:.1f}% (2020-2024)")
    print(f"   • Volatility: {pharma_stats['volatility']:.1f}% (highest among all sectors)")
    
    # Top 3 sectors
    top_3 = sector_stats.head(3)
    print(f"\nTOP 3 ITALIAN EXPORT SECTORS TO USA:")
    for i, (_, row) in enumerate(top_3.iterrows(), 1):
        print(f"   {i}. {row['sector_name']}: EUR{row['total_recent']:.1f}B ({row['growth_rate']:.1f}% growth)")
    
    # Chemical cluster context
    chemical_total = sector_stats[sector_stats['sector'].isin(['5', '54'])]['total_recent'].sum()
    print(f"\nCHEMICAL CLUSTER ANALYSIS:")
    print(f"   • Combined Chemicals + Pharmaceuticals: EUR{chemical_total:.1f}B")
    print(f"   • Pharmaceuticals share of chemical cluster: {(pharma_stats['total_recent']/chemical_total)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Strategic insights
    high_growth_sectors = sector_stats[sector_stats['growth_rate'] > 0]
    print(f"\nSTRATEGIC INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • {len(high_growth_sectors)} of {len(sector_stats)} sectors showing positive growth")
    print(f"   • Pharmaceuticals represent 'high-risk, high-reward' positioning")
    print(f"   • Most volatile sector but part of critical healthcare supply chain")
    print(f"   • Differs from traditional Italian exports (fashion, food, machinery)")
    
    print("\n" + "="*70)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading multi-sector Italian export data...")
    
    # Load and analyze data
    df = load_multi_sector_data()
    sector_stats = calculate_sector_statistics(df)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records covering {len(df['PRODUCT'].unique())} sectors")
    print(f"Time period: {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating multi-sector comparative visualizations...")
    
    generate_market_share_dashboard(df)
    generate_strategic_positioning_matrix(sector_stats)
    generate_sector_ranking_chart(sector_stats)
    generate_pharma_context_analysis(df, sector_stats)
    generate_resilience_comparison(df)
    
    # Print insights
    print_multi_sector_insights(sector_stats, df)
    
    print("\nAll multi-sector visualizations completed!")
    print("New files created:")
    print("   • plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png")
    print("   • plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png") 
    print("   • plots/sector_ranking_chart.png")
    print("   • plots/pharma_context_analysis.png")
    print("   • plots/resilience_comparison.png")

# Italian Pharmaceutical Export Analysis - Project Plan

## Project Overview
Analysis of Italian pharmaceutical exports to the USA vs worldwide to assess potential impacts of Trump administration tariffs on this critical Italian sector.

## Data Source
- **File**: `data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv`
- **Source**: Eurostat (ESTAT:DS-059331) - International trade data
- **Time Range**: January 2002 to May 2025 (monthly data)
- **Product**: SITC Code 54 - Medicinal and pharmaceutical products
- **Partners**: USA and "All countries of the world"
- **Records**: 561 monthly observations

## Key Findings

### Market Size & Importance
- **USA Market**: €7.8 billion annually (2020-2024 average)
- **World Total**: €44.2 billion annually (2020-2024 average)
- **USA Share**: 17.6% of total Italian pharmaceutical exports
- **Growth Performance**: USA market grew 73.7% (2019-2024) vs 66.9% worldwide

### Political Period Analysis
- **Trump 1.0 (2017-2020)**: €397M monthly average to USA
- **Biden (2021-2024)**: €616M monthly average to USA (+55% growth)
- **Market Resilience**: Strong growth maintained across political transitions

### Risk Assessment
- **Peak Monthly Export**: €1.9 billion (indicating high volatility potential)
- **Monthly Volatility**: ±€297M standard deviation
- **Tariff Impact Scenarios**:
  - 10% tariff impact: ~€779M annual revenue at risk
  - 20% tariff impact: ~€1,558M annual revenue at risk

## Visualizations Created

### 1. Timeline Analysis (`official_timeline_chart.png`)
- Dual-axis comparison of USA vs World exports over time
- Highlights Trump presidency periods (2017-2021, 2025+)
- Shows strong growth trajectory in both markets

### 2. Market Share Evolution (`official_market_share_chart.png`)
- USA percentage of total Italian pharma exports over time
- Demonstrates increasing USA market penetration
- Shows volatility periods and trend changes

### 3. Growth Rate Comparison (`official_growth_comparison_chart.png`)
- Year-over-year growth rates for USA, World Total, and Rest of World
- Identifies periods where USA outperformed global markets
- Shows market dynamics during different economic cycles

### 4. Political Periods Analysis (`official_political_periods_chart.png`)
- Export performance by political administration
- Pie chart and bar chart comparing average monthly exports
- Demonstrates market resilience across political changes

### 5. Tariff Impact Scenarios (`official_tariff_scenarios_chart.png`)
- Modeling potential revenue loss under different tariff rates
- Conservative impact assumptions based on demand elasticity
- Shows both projected exports and absolute revenue loss

### 6. Monthly Volatility Heatmap (`official_monthly_heatmap.png`)
- Seasonal patterns and monthly export variations
- Year-over-year comparison showing growth trends
- Identifies peak and low export periods

## Technical Implementation

### Data Processing (`data_processor.py`)
- **Data Loading**: Pandas-based CSV processing with date parsing
- **Market Segmentation**: Separate USA and worldwide export streams
- **Statistical Analysis**: Growth rates, market share calculations, volatility metrics
- **Visualization Engine**: Matplotlib with Italian color scheme (green, white, red)

### Color Scheme & Branding
- **Italy Green**: #009246
- **Italy White**: #FFFFFF  
- **Italy Red**: #CE2B37
- **USA Blue**: #002868

## Key Insights for Presentation

1. **Strategic Importance**: USA represents nearly 18% of Italian pharmaceutical exports, making it a critical market
2. **Growth Momentum**: USA market has consistently outpaced global growth, indicating strong competitive position
3. **Political Resilience**: Exports continued growing during first Trump presidency, suggesting fundamental market strength
4. **High Stakes**: Large absolute values mean even modest tariff impacts could result in hundreds of millions in lost revenue
5. **Market Concentration Risk**: High dependence on USA market creates vulnerability to policy changes

## Methodology Notes

- All calculations based on official Eurostat data
- Growth rates calculated using annual aggregated values
- Market share percentages based on value in EUR, not volume
- Tariff impact scenarios assume 50% demand elasticity (conservative estimate)
- Political periods defined by inauguration dates (January transitions)

## Files Generated

1. `data_processor.py` - Complete analysis and visualization script
2. `official_timeline_chart.png` - Timeline comparison chart
3. `official_market_share_chart.png` - USA market share evolution
4. `official_growth_comparison_chart.png` - Annual growth rate comparison
5. `official_political_periods_chart.png` - Performance by administration
6. `official_tariff_scenarios_chart.png` - Tariff impact modeling
7. `official_monthly_heatmap.png` - Monthly volatility analysis
8. `PLAN.md` - This documentation file

## Next Steps

For future analysis, consider gathering:
- Product-level breakdown within pharmaceuticals (generics vs branded, therapeutic areas)
- Competitor country export data to USA (Germany, Switzerland, France)
- Quarterly company-level export data from major Italian pharma companies
- Historical tariff data and trade agreement impacts

This analysis provides a solid foundation for understanding the potential impact of trade policy changes on Italian pharmaceutical exports to the USA.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
# Italian Pharmaceutical Export Analysis - Project Plan

## Project Overview
Analysis of Italian pharmaceutical exports to the USA vs worldwide to assess potential impacts of Trump administration tariffs on this critical Italian sector.

## Data Source
- **File**: `data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv`
- **Source**: Eurostat (ESTAT:DS-059331) - International trade data
- **Time Range**: January 2002 to May 2025 (monthly data)
- **Product**: SITC Code 54 - Medicinal and pharmaceutical products
- **Partners**: USA and "All countries of the world"
- **Records**: 561 monthly observations

## Key Findings

### Market Size & Importance
- **USA Market**: €7.8 billion annually (2020-2024 average)
- **World Total**: €44.2 billion annually (2020-2024 average)
- **USA Share**: 17.6% of total Italian pharmaceutical exports
- **Growth Performance**: USA market grew 73.7% (2019-2024) vs 66.9% worldwide

### Political Period Analysis
- **Trump 1.0 (2017-2020)**: €397M monthly average to USA
- **Biden (2021-2024)**: €616M monthly average to USA (+55% growth)
- **Market Resilience**: Strong growth maintained across political transitions

### Risk Assessment
- **Peak Monthly Export**: €1.9 billion (indicating high volatility potential)
- **Monthly Volatility**: ±€297M standard deviation
- **Tariff Impact Scenarios**:
  - 10% tariff impact: ~€779M annual revenue at risk
  - 20% tariff impact: ~€1,558M annual revenue at risk

## Visualizations Created

### Core Pharmaceutical Analysis (`plots/` folder)

#### 1. Timeline Analysis (`plots/official_timeline_chart.png`)
- Dual-axis comparison of USA vs World exports over time
- Highlights Trump presidency periods (2017-2021, 2025+)
- Shows strong growth trajectory in both markets

#### 2. Market Share Evolution (`plots/official_market_share_chart.png`)
- USA percentage of total Italian pharma exports over time
- Demonstrates increasing USA market penetration
- Shows volatility periods and trend changes

#### 3. Growth Rate Comparison (`plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png`)
- Year-over-year growth rates for USA, World Total, and Rest of World
- Identifies periods where USA outperformed global markets
- Shows market dynamics during different economic cycles

### Multi-Sector Comparative Analysis (`plots/` folder)

#### 4. Market Share Dashboard (`plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png`)
- Evolution of top 5 Italian export sectors to USA over time
- Market share pie chart showing pharmaceutical's 3rd place ranking
- Context for pharmaceutical exports within broader trade relationship

#### 5. Strategic Positioning Matrix (`plots/strategic_positioning_matrix.png`)
- Growth vs Volatility scatter plot for all major sectors
- Bubble size represents export volume
- Shows pharmaceuticals in "high-risk, high-reward" quadrant

#### 6. Sector Ranking Chart (`plots/sector_ranking_chart.png`)
- Volume ranking: pharmaceuticals = 3rd largest sector (EUR 27.8B)
- Growth performance comparison across all sectors
- Pharmaceuticals showing strongest resilience despite volatility

#### 7. Pharmaceutical Context Analysis (`plots/pharma_context_analysis.png`)
- Pharmaceuticals within broader chemical industry cluster
- Position relative to other Italian export sectors
- Chemical cluster represents EUR 65B+ combined exports

#### 8. Resilience Comparison (`plots/resilience_comparison.png`)
- Sector performance during crisis periods (2008, 2020, 2023-24)
- Demonstrates pharmaceutical sector's relative stability
- Comparison with machinery, chemicals, food, and transport sectors

## Technical Implementation

### Data Processing (`data_processor.py`)
- **Data Loading**: Pandas-based CSV processing with date parsing
- **Market Segmentation**: Separate USA and worldwide export streams
- **Statistical Analysis**: Growth rates, market share calculations, volatility metrics
- **Visualization Engine**: Matplotlib with Italian color scheme (green, white, red)

### Color Scheme & Branding
- **Italy Green**: #009246
- **Italy White**: #FFFFFF  
- **Italy Red**: #CE2B37
- **USA Blue**: #002868

## Key Insights for Presentation

1. **Strategic Importance**: USA represents nearly 18% of Italian pharmaceutical exports, making it a critical market
2. **Growth Momentum**: USA market has consistently outpaced global growth, indicating strong competitive position
3. **Political Resilience**: Exports continued growing during first Trump presidency, suggesting fundamental market strength
4. **High Stakes**: Large absolute values mean even modest tariff impacts could result in hundreds of millions in lost revenue
5. **Market Concentration Risk**: High dependence on USA market creates vulnerability to policy changes

## Methodology Notes

- All calculations based on official Eurostat data
- Growth rates calculated using annual aggregated values
- Market share percentages based on value in EUR, not volume
- Tariff impact scenarios assume 50% demand elasticity (conservative estimate)
- Political periods defined by inauguration dates (January transitions)

## Files Generated

1. `data_processor.py` - Complete analysis and visualization script
2. `official_timeline_chart.png` - Timeline comparison chart
3. `official_market_share_chart.png` - USA market share evolution
4. `official_growth_comparison_chart.png` - Annual growth rate comparison
5. `official_political_periods_chart.png` - Performance by administration
6. `official_tariff_scenarios_chart.png` - Tariff impact modeling
7. `official_monthly_heatmap.png` - Monthly volatility analysis
8. `PLAN.md` - This documentation file

## Next Steps

For future analysis, consider gathering:
- Product-level breakdown within pharmaceuticals (generics vs branded, therapeutic areas)
- Competitor country export data to USA (Germany, Switzerland, France)
- Quarterly company-level export data from major Italian pharma companies
- Historical tariff data and trade agreement impacts

This analysis provides a solid foundation for understanding the potential impact of trade policy changes on Italian pharmaceutical exports to the USA.

lines: - **USA Share**: 17.6% of total Italian pharmaceutical exports
- **Growth Performance**: USA market grew 73.7% (2019-2024) vs 66.9% worldwide
-- **Market Resilience**: Strong growth maintained across political transitions

+- **Chemical Cluster**: Part of €65B+ chemical/pharma export complex
+- **Market Position**: "High-risk, high-reward" sector with highest volatility (37.7%)
+- **Growth Leadership**: Strongest growth rate (4.7% CAGR) among major sectors

+- **Top 5 Sectors**: Machinery (€113B), Chemicals (€53B), Pharmaceuticals (€28B), Road Vehicles (€24B), Food (€23B)

+- **Resilience**: Pharmaceuticals showed better crisis performance vs other sectors
+- **Chemical Integration**: Pharmaceuticals represent 34% of broader chemical sector exports
- **Peak Monthly Export**: €1.9 billion (indicating high volatility potential)
-  - 10% tariff impact: ~€779M annual revenue at risk
-  - 20% tariff impact: ~€1,558M annual revenue at risk
+- **Sector Concentration**: High dependence on chemical/pharma cluster
+- **Policy Sensitivity**: Different risk profile from traditional Italian exports

file.content:
### Market Size & Importance
- **USA Market**: €7.8 billion annually (2020-2024 average)
- **World Total**: €44.2 billion annually (2020-2024 average)
- **USA Share**: 17.6% of total Italian pharmaceutical exports
- **Growth Performance**: USA market grew 73.7% (2019-2024) vs 66.9% worldwide

### Multi-Sector Strategic Context
- **Sector Ranking**: Pharmaceuticals = 3rd largest Italian export sector to USA
- **Chemical Cluster**: Part of €65B+ chemical/pharma export complex
- **Market Position**: "High-risk, high-reward" sector with highest volatility (37.7%)
- **Growth Leadership**: Strongest growth rate (4.7% CAGR) among major sectors
- **Strategic Value**: Represents "new economy" vs traditional Italian exports

### Comparative Sector Analysis
- **Top 5 Sectors**: Machinery (€113B), Chemicals (€53B), Pharmaceuticals (€28B), Road Vehicles (€24B), Food (€23B)
- **Volatility Ranking**: Pharmaceuticals most volatile, textiles least volatile
- **Resilience**: Pharmaceuticals showed better crisis performance vs other sectors
- **Chemical Integration**: Pharmaceuticals represent 34% of broader chemical sector exports

### Risk Assessment
- **Peak Monthly Export**: €1.9 billion (indicating high volatility potential)
- **Monthly Volatility**: ±€297M standard deviation
- **Sector Concentration**: High dependence on chemical/pharma cluster
- **Policy Sensitivity**: Different risk profile from traditional Italian exports

## Visualizations Created

### Core Pharmaceutical Analysis (`plots/` folder)

#### 1. Timeline Analysis (`plots/official_timeline_chart.png`)
- Dual-axis comparison of USA vs World exports over time
- Highlights Trump presidency periods (2017-2021, 2025+)
- Shows strong growth trajectory in both markets

#### 2. Market Share Evolution (`plots/official_market_share_chart.png`)
- USA percentage of total Italian pharma exports over time
- Demonstrates increasing USA market penetration
- Shows volatility periods and trend changes

#### 3. Growth Rate Comparison (`plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png`)
- Year-over-year growth rates for USA, World Total, and Rest of World
- Identifies periods where USA outperformed global markets
- Shows market dynamics during different economic cycles

### Multi-Sector Comparative Analysis (`plots/` folder)

#### 4. Market Share Dashboard (`plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png`)
- Evolution of top 5 Italian export sectors to USA over time
- Market share pie chart showing pharmaceutical's 3rd place ranking

input.command:
uv run -c "
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_pharma_plus_other_sectors.csv')
df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
df['value_billions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000_000

# Recent performance (2020-2025)
recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020].copy()

# Print basic info
print('Sectors available:')
for sector in sorted(df['PRODUCT'].unique()):
    print(f'  {sector}')

print('\nRecent totals by sector (2020-2025):')
sector_totals = recent_data.groupby('PRODUCT')['value_billions'].sum().sort_values(ascending=False)
for sector, total in sector_totals.items():
    print(f'  Sector {sector}: EUR {total:.1f}B')

# Check pharma specifically
pharma_recent = recent_data[recent_data['PRODUCT'] == '54']['value_billions'].sum()
print(f'\nPharmaceuticals (2020-2025): EUR {pharma_recent:.1f}B')

# Chemical cluster
chemicals = recent_data[recent_data['PRODUCT'] == '5']['value_billions'].sum()  
pharma = recent_data[recent_data['PRODUCT'] == '54']['value_billions'].sum()
chemical_cluster = chemicals + pharma
print(f'Chemicals: EUR {chemicals:.1f}B')
print(f'Chemical cluster total: EUR {chemical_cluster:.1f}B')
print(f'Pharma share of cluster: {(pharma/chemical_cluster)*100:.1f}%')
"

print(f'Chemicals: EUR {chemicals:.1f}B')
print(f'Chemical cluster total: EUR {chemical_cluster:.1f}B')
print(f'Pharma share of cluster: {(pharma/chemical_cluster)*100:.1f}%')
"

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_pharma_plus_other_sectors.csv')
df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year

# Recent performance (2020-2025)
recent_data = df[df['year'] >= 2020].copy()

# Print unique products
print('Unique products:')
for product in sorted(df['PRODUCT'].unique()):

# Check pharma specifically
pharma_mask = df['PRODUCT'].str.contains('pharmaceutical', case=False)

if chemical_cluster > 0:
