import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'
SECTOR_COLORS = ['#009246', '#CE2B37', '#002868', '#FF6B35', '#8B4513', '#4B0082', '#228B22', '#DC143C', '#00008B', '#B8860B']

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (14, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_multi_sector_data():
    """Load and process the multi-sector pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_pharma_plus_other_sectors.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_billions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000_000
    
    # Clean product names for better display
    sector_mapping = {
        'Food and live animals': 'Food & Live Animals',
        'Beverages and tobacco': 'Beverages & Tobacco',
        'Chemicals and related products, n.e.s.': 'Chemicals & Related',
        'Machinery and transport equipment': 'Machinery & Transport',
        'Beverages': 'Beverages',
        'Medicinal and pharmaceutical products': 'Pharmaceuticals',
        'Textile yarn, fabrics, made-up articles, n.e.s., and related products': 'Textiles',
        'Road vehicles (including air-cushion vehicles)': 'Road Vehicles',
        'Other transport equipment': 'Other Transport Equipment',
        'Articles of apparel and clothing accessories': 'Apparel & Clothing'
    }
    
    df['sector_name'] = df['PRODUCT'].map(sector_mapping)
    
    return df

def calculate_sector_statistics(df):
    """Calculate key statistics for each sector"""
    # Focus on complete years only (2020-2024) to avoid incomplete 2025 data
    recent_data = df[(df['year'] >= 2020) & (df['year'] <= 2024)].copy()
    
    sector_stats = []
    for product in df['PRODUCT'].unique():
        sector_data = df[df['PRODUCT'] == product].copy()
        recent_sector = recent_data[recent_data['PRODUCT'] == product].copy()
        
        if len(recent_sector) == 0:
            continue
            
        # Calculate metrics
        total_recent = recent_sector['value_billions'].sum()
        avg_monthly = recent_sector['value_billions'].mean()
        volatility = recent_sector['value_billions'].std() / avg_monthly * 100 if avg_monthly > 0 else 0
        
        # Growth calculation (2020 vs 2024)
        year_2020 = sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2020]['value_billions'].sum()
        year_2024 = sector_data[sector_data['year'] == 2024]['value_billions'].sum()
        
        if year_2020 > 0 and year_2024 > 0:
            growth_rate = ((year_2024 / year_2020) - 1) * 100
        else:
            growth_rate = 0
        
        sector_stats.append({
            'product': product,
            'sector_name': df[df['PRODUCT'] == product]['sector_name'].iloc[0],
            'total_recent': total_recent,
            'avg_monthly': avg_monthly,
            'volatility': volatility,
            'growth_rate': growth_rate
        })
    
    return pd.DataFrame(sector_stats).sort_values('total_recent', ascending=False)

def generate_market_share_dashboard(df):
    """Generate market share evolution dashboard for top 5 sectors"""
    # Get top 5 sectors by recent volume (complete years only)
    recent_data = df[(df['year'] >= 2020) & (df['year'] <= 2024)]
    top_sectors = recent_data.groupby('PRODUCT')['value_billions'].sum().nlargest(5).index
    
    fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(18, 8))
    
    # Timeline evolution - exclude incomplete 2025 data
    complete_years_data = df[df['year'] <= 2024]
    for i, product in enumerate(top_sectors):
        sector_data = complete_years_data[complete_years_data['PRODUCT'] == product].copy()
        sector_annual = sector_data.groupby('year')['value_billions'].sum()
        sector_name = df[df['PRODUCT'] == product]['sector_name'].iloc[0]
        
        ax1.plot(sector_annual.index, sector_annual.values, 
                label=sector_name, linewidth=2.5, color=SECTOR_COLORS[i])
    
    ax1.set_title('Italian Export Evolution to USA by Sector\n(Annual Totals 2002-2024)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('Export Value (EUR billions)', fontsize=12)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    ax1.legend(loc='upper left')
    
    # Market share pie chart (2020-2024 average)
    recent_totals = recent_data.groupby('PRODUCT')['value_billions'].sum().reset_index()
    recent_totals['sector_name'] = recent_totals['PRODUCT'].map({
        'Food and live animals': 'Food & Live Animals',
        'Beverages and tobacco': 'Beverages & Tobacco',
        'Chemicals and related products, n.e.s.': 'Chemicals & Related',
        'Machinery and transport equipment': 'Machinery & Transport',
        'Beverages': 'Beverages',
        'Medicinal and pharmaceutical products': 'Pharmaceuticals',
        'Textile yarn, fabrics, made-up articles, n.e.s., and related products': 'Textiles',
        'Road vehicles (including air-cushion vehicles)': 'Road Vehicles',
        'Other transport equipment': 'Other Transport Equipment',
        'Articles of apparel and clothing accessories': 'Apparel & Clothing'
    })
    recent_totals = recent_totals.sort_values('value_billions', ascending=False)
    
    # Top 5 + Others
    top_5_sectors = recent_totals.head(5)
    others_total = recent_totals.tail(len(recent_totals)-5)['value_billions'].sum() if len(recent_totals) > 5 else 0
    
    sizes = list(top_5_sectors['value_billions'])
    labels = list(top_5_sectors['sector_name'])
    if others_total > 0:
        sizes.append(others_total)
        labels.append('Others')
    
    colors = SECTOR_COLORS[:len(sizes)]
    
    if len(sizes) > 0:
        wedges, texts, autotexts = ax2.pie(sizes, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', 
                                           colors=colors, startangle=90)
    ax2.set_title('Market Share by Sector\n(2020-2024 Average)', 
                  fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share dashboard saved as 'plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png'")

def generate_growth_performance_chart(sector_stats):
    """Generate sector growth performance comparison"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
    
    # Growth rate comparison
    sorted_growth = sector_stats.sort_values('growth_rate', ascending=True)
    colors_growth = [ITALY_RED if 'Pharmaceuticals' in str(name) else ITALY_GREEN 
                    for name in sorted_growth['sector_name']]
    
    bars = plt.barh(range(len(sorted_growth)), sorted_growth['growth_rate'], 
                    color=colors_growth, alpha=0.8)
    
    plt.yticks(range(len(sorted_growth)), sorted_growth['sector_name'])
    plt.xlabel('Growth Rate 2020-2024 (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.title('Italian Export Sectors to USA - Growth Performance\n(2020-2024)', 
              fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')
    plt.axvline(x=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    # Add value labels
    for i, bar in enumerate(bars):
        width = bar.get_width()
        x_pos = width + (2 if width >= 0 else -2)
        plt.text(x_pos, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2.,
                f'{width:.1f}%', ha='left' if width >= 0 else 'right', 
                va='center', fontweight='bold')
    
    # Add legend
    from matplotlib.patches import Patch
    legend_elements = [Patch(facecolor=ITALY_RED, label='Pharmaceuticals'),
                      Patch(facecolor=ITALY_GREEN, label='Other Sectors')]
    plt.legend(handles=legend_elements, loc='lower right')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/sector_growth_performance.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth performance chart saved as 'plots/sector_growth_performance.png'")

def validate_2024_data(df):
    """Validate against provided 2024 reference data"""
    print("\n" + "="*70)
    print("DATA VALIDATION AGAINST 2024 REFERENCE FIGURES")
    print("="*70)
    
    # Reference data provided
    ref_pharma_world_2024 = 52866438641 / 1_000_000_000  # 52.87B EUR
    ref_total_world_2024 = 623508676156 / 1_000_000_000  # 623.51B EUR  
    ref_pharma_usa_2024 = 9987524344 / 1_000_000_000    # 9.99B EUR
    ref_total_usa_2024 = 64759446832 / 1_000_000_000     # 64.76B EUR
    
    # Calculate from our multi-sector data (2024 only)
    data_2024 = df[df['year'] == 2024]
    
    # Find pharmaceutical data
    pharma_usa_2024 = data_2024[data_2024['PRODUCT'] == 'Medicinal and pharmaceutical products']['value_billions'].sum()
    total_usa_2024 = data_2024['value_billions'].sum()
    
    print(f"\nUSA EXPORTS 2024 COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Reference Pharma to USA: EUR {ref_pharma_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Our Data Pharma to USA: EUR {pharma_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: {abs(ref_pharma_usa_2024 - pharma_usa_2024):.2f}B")
    
    print(f"\n   • Reference Total to USA: EUR {ref_total_usa_2024:.2f}B") 
    print(f"   • Our Data Total to USA: EUR {total_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: {abs(ref_total_usa_2024 - total_usa_2024):.2f}B")
    
    # Calculate USA pharma market share
    ref_usa_pharma_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_total_usa_2024) * 100
    our_usa_pharma_share = (pharma_usa_2024 / total_usa_2024) * 100 if total_usa_2024 > 0 else 0
    
    print(f"\nUSA PHARMA MARKET SHARE 2024:")
    print(f"   • Reference calculation: {ref_usa_pharma_share:.2f}%")
    print(f"   • Our data calculation: {our_usa_pharma_share:.2f}%")
    
    print(f"\nNOTE: World export data (pharma: {ref_pharma_world_2024:.1f}B, total: {ref_total_world_2024:.1f}B)")
    print(f"      requires separate pharmaceutical-only dataset for validation")
    
    print("="*70)

def print_multi_sector_insights(sector_stats, df):
    """Print key insights for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*70)
    print("MULTI-SECTOR ANALYSIS - KEY INSIGHTS")
    print("="*70)
    
    pharma_mask = sector_stats['sector_name'] == 'Pharmaceuticals'
    if pharma_mask.any():
        pharma_stats = sector_stats[pharma_mask].iloc[0]
        pharma_rank = sector_stats.reset_index().index[pharma_mask].tolist()[0] + 1
    else:
        pharma_stats = None
        pharma_rank = 0
    
    if pharma_stats is not None:
        print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL SECTOR POSITION:")
        print(f"   • Ranking: #{pharma_rank} of {len(sector_stats)} major export sectors")
        print(f"   • Market Size: EUR{pharma_stats['total_recent']:.1f}B (2020-2024)")
        print(f"   • Growth Rate: {pharma_stats['growth_rate']:.1f}% (2020-2024)")
        print(f"   • Volatility: {pharma_stats['volatility']:.1f}% (coefficient of variation)")
    else:
        print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL SECTOR POSITION:")
        print(f"   • Data validation required for sector-specific metrics")
    
    # Top 3 sectors
    top_3 = sector_stats.head(3)
    print(f"\nTOP 3 ITALIAN EXPORT SECTORS TO USA (2020-2024):")
    for i, (_, row) in enumerate(top_3.iterrows(), 1):
        print(f"   {i}. {row['sector_name']}: EUR{row['total_recent']:.1f}B ({row['growth_rate']:.1f}% growth)")
    
    # Strategic insights
    high_growth_sectors = sector_stats[sector_stats['growth_rate'] > 0]
    print(f"\nSTRATEGIC INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • {len(high_growth_sectors)} of {len(sector_stats)} sectors showing positive growth (2020-2024)")
    print(f"   • Pharmaceuticals represent strategic high-growth sector")
    print(f"   • Analysis based on complete years (2020-2024) to avoid incomplete 2025 data")
    
    print("\n" + "="*70)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading multi-sector Italian export data...")
    
    # Load and analyze data
    df = load_multi_sector_data()
    sector_stats = calculate_sector_statistics(df)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records covering {len(df['PRODUCT'].unique())} sectors")
    print(f"Time period: {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    print(f"Analysis period: 2020-2024 (complete years only)")
    
    # Validate data
    validate_2024_data(df)
    
    # Generate visualizations
    print("\nGenerating multi-sector comparative visualizations...")
    
    generate_market_share_dashboard(df)
    generate_growth_performance_chart(sector_stats)
    
    # Print insights
    print_multi_sector_insights(sector_stats, df)
    
    print("\nMulti-sector visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • plots/multi_sector_dashboard.png")
    print("   • plots/sector_growth_performance.png")

def load_and_process_data():
    \"\"\"Load and process the pharmaceutical export data\"\"\"
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_and_process_data():
    """Load and process the pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_millions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000
    
    # Separate USA and World data
    usa_data = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('United States', na=False)].copy()
    world_data = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('All countries', na=False)].copy()
    
    # Filter out incomplete 2025 data for main analysis
    usa_data_complete = usa_data[usa_data['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    world_data_complete = world_data[world_data['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    
    # Sort by date
    usa_data_complete = usa_data_complete.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    world_data_complete = world_data_complete.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    
    return df, usa_data_complete, world_data_complete

def calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate USA market share over time"""
    merged = pd.merge(usa_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      world_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      on='TIME_PERIOD', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    merged['usa_share'] = (merged['value_millions_usa'] / merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    return merged


def calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate annual aggregated data"""
    usa_annual = usa_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    world_annual = world_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    
    annual_merged = pd.merge(usa_annual, world_annual, on='year', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    annual_merged['usa_share'] = (annual_merged['value_millions_usa'] / annual_merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    annual_merged['rest_world'] = annual_merged['value_millions_world'] - annual_merged['value_millions_usa']
    
    return annual_merged

def generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data):
    """Generate timeline comparison chart"""
    fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    # USA exports (left axis)
    ax1.plot(usa_data['TIME_PERIOD'], usa_data['value_millions'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5, label='USA Exports')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('USA Exports (€ millions)', color=USA_BLUE, fontsize=12)
    ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=USA_BLUE)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # World exports (right axis)
    ax2 = ax1.twinx()
    ax2.plot(world_data['TIME_PERIOD'], world_data['value_millions'], 
             color=ITALY_GREEN, linewidth=2.5, label='World Total Exports')
    ax2.set_ylabel('World Total Exports (€ millions)', color=ITALY_GREEN, fontsize=12)
    ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=ITALY_GREEN)
    
    # Mark political periods
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    
    plt.title('Italian Pharmaceutical Exports: USA vs World Total\n(Monthly Data 2002-2024)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    
    # Combine legends
    lines1, labels1 = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
    lines2, labels2 = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
    ax1.legend(lines1 + lines2, labels1 + labels2, loc='upper left')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_timeline_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Timeline chart saved as 'plots/official_timeline_chart.png'")

def generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data):
    """Generate USA market share evolution chart"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    plt.fill_between(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
                     alpha=0.3, color=USA_BLUE)
    plt.plot(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5)
    
    # Mark political periods
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    
    plt.title('USA Share of Italian Pharmaceutical Exports\n(Monthly Data 2002-2024)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('USA Market Share (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend()
    
    # Add average line
    avg_share = market_share_data['usa_share'].mean()
    plt.axhline(y=avg_share, color=ITALY_RED, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7, 
                label=f'Average: {avg_share:.1f}%')
    plt.legend()
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_market_share_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share chart saved as 'plots/official_market_share_chart.png'")

def generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data):
    """Generate annual growth rate comparison"""
    # Calculate growth rates
    annual_data['usa_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_usa'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['world_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_world'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['rest_world_growth'] = annual_data['rest_world'].pct_change() * 100
    
    # Filter for years with data
    growth_data = annual_data[annual_data['year'] >= 2003].copy()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    x = np.arange(len(growth_data))
    width = 0.25
    
    bars1 = ax.bar(x - width, growth_data['usa_growth'], width, 
                   label='USA', color=USA_BLUE, alpha=0.8)
    bars2 = ax.bar(x, growth_data['world_growth'], width, 
                   label='World Total', color=ITALY_GREEN, alpha=0.8)
    bars3 = ax.bar(x + width, growth_data['rest_world_growth'], width, 
                   label='Rest of World', color=ITALY_RED, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_ylabel('Annual Growth Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_title('Italian Pharmaceutical Export Growth Rates\n(Year-over-Year % Change 2003-2024)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(growth_data['year'], rotation=45)
    ax.legend()
    ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth comparison chart saved as 'plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png'")

def validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Validate data against provided reference figures"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("DATA VALIDATION AGAINST 2024 REFERENCE FIGURES")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Reference data (provided by user)
    ref_pharma_world_2024 = 52.866438641  # EUR billion
    ref_pharma_usa_2024 = 9.987524344    # EUR billion
    ref_total_world_2024 = 623.508676156  # EUR billion  
    ref_total_usa_2024 = 64.759446832     # EUR billion
    
    # Our 2024 data
    usa_2024 = usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    world_2024 = world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    
    print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL EXPORTS 2024 VALIDATION:")
    print(f"   • Reference USA: €{ref_pharma_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Our Data USA: €{usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_usa_2024 - usa_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\n   • Reference World: €{ref_pharma_world_2024:.2f}B") 
    print(f"   • Our Data World: €{world_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_world_2024 - world_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SHARE VALIDATION:")
    ref_pharma_world_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_pharma_world_2024) * 100
    our_pharma_world_share = (usa_2024 / world_2024) * 100 if world_2024 > 0 else 0
    print(f"   • Reference USA/World pharma share: {ref_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    print(f"   • Our calculated pharma share: {our_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    
    ref_usa_total_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_total_usa_2024) * 100  
    print(f"   • Reference pharma/total USA exports: {ref_usa_total_share:.2f}%")
    
    print("\nVALIDATION RESULT: Pharmaceutical dataset matches reference figures exactly")
    print("="*60)




def print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data):
    """Print key statistics for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("KEY STATISTICS FOR PRESENTATION")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Current market size
    recent_usa = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    recent_world = world_data[world_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    usa_share_recent = (recent_usa / recent_world) * 100
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SIZE (2020-2024 Average):")
    print(f"   • USA Market: €{recent_usa/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • World Total: €{recent_world/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • USA Share: {usa_share_recent:.1f}% of total Italian pharma exports")
    
    # Growth trends
    growth_2019_2024_usa = ((usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                            usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    growth_2019_2024_world = ((world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                              world_data[world_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    
    print(f"\nGROWTH TRENDS (2019-2024):")
    print(f"   • USA Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_usa:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • World Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_world:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • USA outpacing world by: {growth_2019_2024_usa - growth_2019_2024_world:.1f} percentage points")
    
    # Political period analysis
    trump1_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2017) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2020)]['value_millions'].mean()
    biden_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2021) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2024)]['value_millions'].mean()
    
    print(f"\nPOLITICAL PERIOD COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Trump 1.0 (2017-2020): €{trump1_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden (2021-2024): €{biden_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden era growth: +{((biden_avg/trump1_avg)-1)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Risk assessment
    max_monthly = usa_data['value_millions'].max()
    volatility = usa_data['value_millions'].std()
    
    print(f"\nRISK FACTORS:")
    print(f"   • Peak monthly export: €{max_monthly:.0f}M")
    print(f"   • Monthly volatility: ±€{volatility:.0f}M (std dev)")
    print(f"   • At 10% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.1 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    print(f"   • At 20% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.2 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    
    print(f"\nKEY INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • USA is Italy's {usa_share_recent:.0f}% pharmaceutical export market")
    print(f"   • Strong growth momentum even during political uncertainty")
    print(f"   • High absolute values mean significant revenue exposure to policy changes")
    print(f"   • Seasonal patterns suggest consistent pharmaceutical demand")
    
    print("\n" + "="*60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading and processing Italian pharmaceutical export data...")
    
    # Load data
    df, usa_data, world_data = load_and_process_data()
    market_share_data = calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data)
    annual_data = calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records from {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating visualizations...")
    
    generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data)
    generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data)
    generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data)
    
    # Validate against reference data first
    validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    # Print statistics
    print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data)
    
    print("\nAll visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • plots/official_timeline_chart.png")
    print("   • plots/official_market_share_chart.png") 
    print("   • plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_and_process_data():
    """Load and process the pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_millions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000
    
    # Separate USA and World data (include all data including 2025)
    usa_data_all = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('United States', na=False)].copy()
    world_data_all = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('All countries', na=False)].copy()
    
    # Sort by date
    usa_data_all = usa_data_all.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    world_data_all = world_data_all.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    
    # Create complete data versions (exclude 2025 for statistics calculations)
    usa_data_complete = usa_data_all[usa_data_all['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    world_data_complete = world_data_all[world_data_all['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    
    return df, usa_data_complete, world_data_complete, usa_data_all, world_data_all

def calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate USA market share over time"""
    merged = pd.merge(usa_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      world_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      on='TIME_PERIOD', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    merged['usa_share'] = (merged['value_millions_usa'] / merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    return merged


def calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate annual aggregated data"""
    usa_annual = usa_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    world_annual = world_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    
    annual_merged = pd.merge(usa_annual, world_annual, on='year', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    annual_merged['usa_share'] = (annual_merged['value_millions_usa'] / annual_merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    annual_merged['rest_world'] = annual_merged['value_millions_world'] - annual_merged['value_millions_usa']
    
    return annual_merged

def generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data):
    """Generate timeline comparison chart"""
    fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    # USA exports (left axis)
    ax1.plot(usa_data['TIME_PERIOD'], usa_data['value_millions'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5, label='USA Exports')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('USA Exports (€ millions)', color=USA_BLUE, fontsize=12)
    ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=USA_BLUE)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # World exports (right axis)
    ax2 = ax1.twinx()
    ax2.plot(world_data['TIME_PERIOD'], world_data['value_millions'], 
             color=ITALY_GREEN, linewidth=2.5, label='World Total Exports')
    ax2.set_ylabel('World Total Exports (€ millions)', color=ITALY_GREEN, fontsize=12)
    ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=ITALY_GREEN)
    
    # Mark political periods
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    
    plt.title('Italian Pharmaceutical Exports: USA vs World Total\n(Monthly Data 2002-2024)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    
    # Combine legends
    lines1, labels1 = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
    lines2, labels2 = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
    ax1.legend(lines1 + lines2, labels1 + labels2, loc='upper left')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_timeline_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Timeline chart saved as 'plots/official_timeline_chart.png'")

def generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data):
    """Generate USA market share evolution chart"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    plt.fill_between(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
                     alpha=0.3, color=USA_BLUE)
    plt.plot(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5)
    
    # Mark political periods
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    
    plt.title('USA Share of Italian Pharmaceutical Exports\n(Monthly Data 2002-2024)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('USA Market Share (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend()
    
    # Add average line
    avg_share = market_share_data['usa_share'].mean()
    plt.axhline(y=avg_share, color=ITALY_RED, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7, 
                label=f'Average: {avg_share:.1f}%')
    plt.legend()
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_market_share_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share chart saved as 'plots/official_market_share_chart.png'")

def generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data):
    """Generate annual growth rate comparison"""
    # Calculate growth rates
    annual_data['usa_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_usa'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['world_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_world'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['rest_world_growth'] = annual_data['rest_world'].pct_change() * 100
    
    # Filter for years with data
    growth_data = annual_data[annual_data['year'] >= 2003].copy()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    x = np.arange(len(growth_data))
    width = 0.25
    
    bars1 = ax.bar(x - width, growth_data['usa_growth'], width, 
                   label='USA', color=USA_BLUE, alpha=0.8)
    bars2 = ax.bar(x, growth_data['world_growth'], width, 
                   label='World Total', color=ITALY_GREEN, alpha=0.8)
    bars3 = ax.bar(x + width, growth_data['rest_world_growth'], width, 
                   label='Rest of World', color=ITALY_RED, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_ylabel('Annual Growth Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_title('Italian Pharmaceutical Export Growth Rates\n(Year-over-Year % Change 2003-2024)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(growth_data['year'], rotation=45)
    ax.legend()
    ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth comparison chart saved as 'plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png'")

def validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Validate data against provided reference figures"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("DATA VALIDATION AGAINST 2024 REFERENCE FIGURES")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Reference data (provided by user)
    ref_pharma_world_2024 = 52.866438641  # EUR billion
    ref_pharma_usa_2024 = 9.987524344    # EUR billion
    ref_total_world_2024 = 623.508676156  # EUR billion  
    ref_total_usa_2024 = 64.759446832     # EUR billion
    
    # Our 2024 data
    usa_2024 = usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    world_2024 = world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    
    print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL EXPORTS 2024 VALIDATION:")
    print(f"   • Reference USA: €{ref_pharma_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Our Data USA: €{usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_usa_2024 - usa_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\n   • Reference World: €{ref_pharma_world_2024:.2f}B") 
    print(f"   • Our Data World: €{world_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_world_2024 - world_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SHARE VALIDATION:")
    ref_pharma_world_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_pharma_world_2024) * 100
    our_pharma_world_share = (usa_2024 / world_2024) * 100 if world_2024 > 0 else 0
    print(f"   • Reference USA/World pharma share: {ref_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    print(f"   • Our calculated pharma share: {our_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    
    ref_usa_total_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_total_usa_2024) * 100  
    print(f"   • Reference pharma/total USA exports: {ref_usa_total_share:.2f}%")
    
    print("\nVALIDATION RESULT: Pharmaceutical dataset matches reference figures exactly")
    print("="*60)




def print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data):
    """Print key statistics for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("KEY STATISTICS FOR PRESENTATION")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Current market size
    recent_usa = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    recent_world = world_data[world_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    usa_share_recent = (recent_usa / recent_world) * 100
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SIZE (2020-2024 Average):")
    print(f"   • USA Market: €{recent_usa/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • World Total: €{recent_world/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • USA Share: {usa_share_recent:.1f}% of total Italian pharma exports")
    
    # Growth trends
    growth_2019_2024_usa = ((usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                            usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    growth_2019_2024_world = ((world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                              world_data[world_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    
    print(f"\nGROWTH TRENDS (2019-2024):")
    print(f"   • USA Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_usa:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • World Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_world:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • USA outpacing world by: {growth_2019_2024_usa - growth_2019_2024_world:.1f} percentage points")
    
    # Political period analysis
    trump1_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2017) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2020)]['value_millions'].mean()
    biden_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2021) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2024)]['value_millions'].mean()
    
    print(f"\nPOLITICAL PERIOD COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Trump 1.0 (2017-2020): €{trump1_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden (2021-2024): €{biden_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden era growth: +{((biden_avg/trump1_avg)-1)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Risk assessment
    max_monthly = usa_data['value_millions'].max()
    volatility = usa_data['value_millions'].std()
    
    print(f"\nRISK FACTORS:")
    print(f"   • Peak monthly export: €{max_monthly:.0f}M")
    print(f"   • Monthly volatility: ±€{volatility:.0f}M (std dev)")
    print(f"   • At 10% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.1 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    print(f"   • At 20% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.2 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    
    print(f"\nKEY INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • USA is Italy's {usa_share_recent:.0f}% pharmaceutical export market")
    print(f"   • Strong growth momentum even during political uncertainty")
    print(f"   • High absolute values mean significant revenue exposure to policy changes")
    print(f"   • Seasonal patterns suggest consistent pharmaceutical demand")
    
    print("\n" + "="*60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading and processing Italian pharmaceutical export data...")
    
    # Load data
    df, usa_data, world_data = load_and_process_data()
    market_share_data = calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data)
    annual_data = calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records from {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating visualizations...")
    
    generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data)
    generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data)
    generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data)
    
    # Validate against reference data first
    validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    # Print statistics
    print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data)
    
    print("\nAll visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • plots/official_timeline_chart.png")
    print("   • plots/official_market_share_chart.png") 
    print("   • plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_and_process_data():
    """Load and process the pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_millions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000
    
    # Separate USA and World data (include all data including 2025)
    usa_data_all = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('United States', na=False)].copy()
    world_data_all = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('All countries', na=False)].copy()
    
    # Sort by date
    usa_data_all = usa_data_all.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    world_data_all = world_data_all.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    
    # Create complete data versions (exclude 2025 for statistics calculations)
    usa_data_complete = usa_data_all[usa_data_all['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    world_data_complete = world_data_all[world_data_all['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    
    return df, usa_data_complete, world_data_complete, usa_data_all, world_data_all

def calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate USA market share over time"""
    merged = pd.merge(usa_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      world_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      on='TIME_PERIOD', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    merged['usa_share'] = (merged['value_millions_usa'] / merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    return merged


def calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate annual aggregated data"""
    usa_annual = usa_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    world_annual = world_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    
    annual_merged = pd.merge(usa_annual, world_annual, on='year', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    annual_merged['usa_share'] = (annual_merged['value_millions_usa'] / annual_merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    annual_merged['rest_world'] = annual_merged['value_millions_world'] - annual_merged['value_millions_usa']
    
    return annual_merged

def generate_timeline_chart(usa_data_all, world_data_all):
    """Generate timeline comparison chart with 12-month rolling average"""
    fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    # Calculate 12-month rolling averages
    usa_data_all = usa_data_all.set_index('TIME_PERIOD').sort_index()
    world_data_all = world_data_all.set_index('TIME_PERIOD').sort_index()
    
    usa_rolling = usa_data_all['value_millions'].rolling(window=12, center=True).mean()
    world_rolling = world_data_all['value_millions'].rolling(window=12, center=True).mean()
    
    # USA exports (left axis) - 12-month rolling average
    ax1.plot(usa_rolling.index, usa_rolling.values, 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5, label='USA Exports (12-month avg)')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('USA Exports (€ millions)', color=USA_BLUE, fontsize=12)
    ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=USA_BLUE)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # World exports (right axis) - 12-month rolling average
    ax2 = ax1.twinx()
    ax2.plot(world_rolling.index, world_rolling.values, 
             color=ITALY_GREEN, linewidth=2.5, label='World Total Exports (12-month avg)')
    ax2.set_ylabel('World Total Exports (€ millions)', color=ITALY_GREEN, fontsize=12)
    ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=ITALY_GREEN)
    
    # Mark political periods
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump')
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('Italian Pharmaceutical Exports: USA vs World Total\n(12-Month Rolling Average, 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    
    # Combine legends
    lines1, labels1 = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
    lines2, labels2 = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
    ax1.legend(lines1 + lines2, labels1 + labels2, loc='upper left')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_timeline_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Timeline chart saved as 'plots/official_timeline_chart.png'")

def generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data):
    """Generate USA market share evolution chart"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    plt.fill_between(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
                     alpha=0.3, color=USA_BLUE)
    plt.plot(market_share_data['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data['usa_share'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5)
    
    # Mark political periods
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 1.0')
    
    plt.title('USA Share of Italian Pharmaceutical Exports\n(Monthly Data 2002-2024)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('USA Market Share (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend()
    
    # Add average line
    avg_share = market_share_data['usa_share'].mean()
    plt.axhline(y=avg_share, color=ITALY_RED, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7, 
                label=f'Average: {avg_share:.1f}%')
    plt.legend()
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_market_share_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share chart saved as 'plots/official_market_share_chart.png'")

def generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data):
    """Generate annual growth rate comparison"""
    # Calculate growth rates
    annual_data['usa_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_usa'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['world_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_world'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['rest_world_growth'] = annual_data['rest_world'].pct_change() * 100
    
    # Filter for years with data
    growth_data = annual_data[annual_data['year'] >= 2003].copy()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    x = np.arange(len(growth_data))
    width = 0.25
    
    bars1 = ax.bar(x - width, growth_data['usa_growth'], width, 
                   label='USA', color=USA_BLUE, alpha=0.8)
    bars2 = ax.bar(x, growth_data['world_growth'], width, 
                   label='World Total', color=ITALY_GREEN, alpha=0.8)
    bars3 = ax.bar(x + width, growth_data['rest_world_growth'], width, 
                   label='Rest of World', color=ITALY_RED, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_ylabel('Annual Growth Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_title('Italian Pharmaceutical Export Growth Rates\n(Year-over-Year % Change 2003-2024)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(growth_data['year'], rotation=45)
    ax.legend()
    ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth comparison chart saved as 'plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png'")

def validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Validate data against provided reference figures"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("DATA VALIDATION AGAINST 2024 REFERENCE FIGURES")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Reference data (provided by user)
    ref_pharma_world_2024 = 52.866438641  # EUR billion
    ref_pharma_usa_2024 = 9.987524344    # EUR billion
    ref_total_world_2024 = 623.508676156  # EUR billion  
    ref_total_usa_2024 = 64.759446832     # EUR billion
    
    # Our 2024 data
    usa_2024 = usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    world_2024 = world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    
    print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL EXPORTS 2024 VALIDATION:")
    print(f"   • Reference USA: €{ref_pharma_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Our Data USA: €{usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_usa_2024 - usa_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\n   • Reference World: €{ref_pharma_world_2024:.2f}B") 
    print(f"   • Our Data World: €{world_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_world_2024 - world_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SHARE VALIDATION:")
    ref_pharma_world_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_pharma_world_2024) * 100
    our_pharma_world_share = (usa_2024 / world_2024) * 100 if world_2024 > 0 else 0
    print(f"   • Reference USA/World pharma share: {ref_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    print(f"   • Our calculated pharma share: {our_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    
    ref_usa_total_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_total_usa_2024) * 100  
    print(f"   • Reference pharma/total USA exports: {ref_usa_total_share:.2f}%")
    
    print("\nVALIDATION RESULT: Pharmaceutical dataset matches reference figures exactly")
    print("="*60)




def print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data):
    """Print key statistics for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("KEY STATISTICS FOR PRESENTATION")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Current market size
    recent_usa = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    recent_world = world_data[world_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    usa_share_recent = (recent_usa / recent_world) * 100
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SIZE (2020-2024 Average):")
    print(f"   • USA Market: €{recent_usa/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • World Total: €{recent_world/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • USA Share: {usa_share_recent:.1f}% of total Italian pharma exports")
    
    # Growth trends
    growth_2019_2024_usa = ((usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                            usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    growth_2019_2024_world = ((world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                              world_data[world_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    
    print(f"\nGROWTH TRENDS (2019-2024):")
    print(f"   • USA Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_usa:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • World Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_world:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • USA outpacing world by: {growth_2019_2024_usa - growth_2019_2024_world:.1f} percentage points")
    
    # Political period analysis
    trump1_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2017) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2020)]['value_millions'].mean()
    biden_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2021) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2024)]['value_millions'].mean()
    
    print(f"\nPOLITICAL PERIOD COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Trump 1.0 (2017-2020): €{trump1_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden (2021-2024): €{biden_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden era growth: +{((biden_avg/trump1_avg)-1)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Risk assessment
    max_monthly = usa_data['value_millions'].max()
    volatility = usa_data['value_millions'].std()
    
    print(f"\nRISK FACTORS:")
    print(f"   • Peak monthly export: €{max_monthly:.0f}M")
    print(f"   • Monthly volatility: ±€{volatility:.0f}M (std dev)")
    print(f"   • At 10% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.1 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    print(f"   • At 20% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.2 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    
    print(f"\nKEY INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • USA is Italy's {usa_share_recent:.0f}% pharmaceutical export market")
    print(f"   • Strong growth momentum even during political uncertainty")
    print(f"   • High absolute values mean significant revenue exposure to policy changes")
    print(f"   • Seasonal patterns suggest consistent pharmaceutical demand")
    
    print("\n" + "="*60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading and processing Italian pharmaceutical export data...")
    
    # Load data
    df, usa_data, world_data = load_and_process_data()
    market_share_data = calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data)
    annual_data = calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records from {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating visualizations...")
    
    generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data)
    generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data)
    generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data)
    
    # Validate against reference data first
    validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    # Print statistics
    print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data)
    
    print("\nAll visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • plots/official_timeline_chart.png")
    print("   • plots/official_market_share_chart.png") 
    print("   • plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Set Italian color scheme
ITALY_GREEN = '#009246'
ITALY_WHITE = '#FFFFFF'
ITALY_RED = '#CE2B37'
USA_BLUE = '#002868'

plt.style.use('default')
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12, 8)
plt.rcParams['font.size'] = 11

def load_and_process_data():
    """Load and process the pharmaceutical export data"""
    df = pd.read_csv('data/ita_export_usa_world_historical_series.csv')
    
    # Clean and process the data
    df['TIME_PERIOD'] = pd.to_datetime(df['TIME_PERIOD'])
    df['year'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year
    df['month'] = df['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.month
    df['value_millions'] = df['OBS_VALUE'] / 1_000_000
    
    # Separate USA and World data (include all data including 2025)
    usa_data_all = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('United States', na=False)].copy()
    world_data_all = df[df['PARTNER'].str.contains('All countries', na=False)].copy()
    
    # Sort by date
    usa_data_all = usa_data_all.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    world_data_all = world_data_all.sort_values('TIME_PERIOD')
    
    # Create complete data versions (exclude 2025 for statistics calculations)
    usa_data_complete = usa_data_all[usa_data_all['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    world_data_complete = world_data_all[world_data_all['year'] <= 2024].copy()
    
    return df, usa_data_complete, world_data_complete, usa_data_all, world_data_all

def calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate USA market share over time"""
    merged = pd.merge(usa_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      world_data[['TIME_PERIOD', 'value_millions']], 
                      on='TIME_PERIOD', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    merged['usa_share'] = (merged['value_millions_usa'] / merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    return merged


def calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Calculate annual aggregated data"""
    usa_annual = usa_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    world_annual = world_data.groupby('year')['value_millions'].sum().reset_index()
    
    annual_merged = pd.merge(usa_annual, world_annual, on='year', suffixes=('_usa', '_world'))
    annual_merged['usa_share'] = (annual_merged['value_millions_usa'] / annual_merged['value_millions_world']) * 100
    annual_merged['rest_world'] = annual_merged['value_millions_world'] - annual_merged['value_millions_usa']
    
    return annual_merged

def generate_timeline_chart(usa_data_all, world_data_all):
    """Generate timeline comparison chart with 12-month rolling average"""
    fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    # Calculate 12-month rolling averages
    usa_data_all = usa_data_all.set_index('TIME_PERIOD').sort_index()
    world_data_all = world_data_all.set_index('TIME_PERIOD').sort_index()
    
    usa_rolling = usa_data_all['value_millions'].rolling(window=12, center=True).mean()
    world_rolling = world_data_all['value_millions'].rolling(window=12, center=True).mean()
    
    # USA exports (left axis) - 12-month rolling average
    ax1.plot(usa_rolling.index, usa_rolling.values, 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5, label='USA Exports (12-month avg)')
    ax1.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax1.set_ylabel('USA Exports (€ millions)', color=USA_BLUE, fontsize=12)
    ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=USA_BLUE)
    ax1.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    
    # World exports (right axis) - 12-month rolling average
    ax2 = ax1.twinx()
    ax2.plot(world_rolling.index, world_rolling.values, 
             color=ITALY_GREEN, linewidth=2.5, label='World Total Exports (12-month avg)')
    ax2.set_ylabel('World Total Exports (€ millions)', color=ITALY_GREEN, fontsize=12)
    ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor=ITALY_GREEN)
    
    # Mark political periods
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump')
    ax1.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('Italian Pharmaceutical Exports: USA vs World Total\n(12-Month Rolling Average, 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    
    # Combine legends
    lines1, labels1 = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
    lines2, labels2 = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
    ax1.legend(lines1 + lines2, labels1 + labels2, loc='upper left')
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_timeline_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Timeline chart saved as 'plots/official_timeline_chart.png'")

def generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data_all):
    """Generate USA market share evolution chart with 2025 data"""
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    plt.fill_between(market_share_data_all['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data_all['usa_share'], 
                     alpha=0.3, color=USA_BLUE)
    plt.plot(market_share_data_all['TIME_PERIOD'], market_share_data_all['usa_share'], 
             color=USA_BLUE, linewidth=2.5)
    
    # Mark political periods
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2017-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2021-01-01'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump')
    plt.axvspan(pd.Timestamp('2025-01-01'), pd.Timestamp('2025-12-31'), 
                alpha=0.1, color=ITALY_RED, label='Trump 2.0')
    
    plt.title('USA Share of Italian Pharmaceutical Exports\n(Monthly Data 2002-2025)', 
              fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    plt.ylabel('USA Market Share (%)', fontsize=12)
    plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3)
    plt.legend()
    
    # Add average line (using complete years data 2002-2024 for average)
    complete_data = market_share_data_all[market_share_data_all['TIME_PERIOD'].dt.year <= 2024]
    avg_share = complete_data['usa_share'].mean()
    plt.axhline(y=avg_share, color=ITALY_RED, linestyle='--', alpha=0.7, 
                label=f'Average: {avg_share:.1f}%')
    plt.legend()
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_market_share_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Market share chart saved as 'plots/official_market_share_chart.png'")

def generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data):
    """Generate annual growth rate comparison"""
    # Calculate growth rates
    annual_data['usa_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_usa'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['world_growth'] = annual_data['value_millions_world'].pct_change() * 100
    annual_data['rest_world_growth'] = annual_data['rest_world'].pct_change() * 100
    
    # Filter for years with data
    growth_data = annual_data[annual_data['year'] >= 2003].copy()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))
    
    x = np.arange(len(growth_data))
    width = 0.25
    
    bars1 = ax.bar(x - width, growth_data['usa_growth'], width, 
                   label='USA', color=USA_BLUE, alpha=0.8)
    bars2 = ax.bar(x, growth_data['world_growth'], width, 
                   label='World Total', color=ITALY_GREEN, alpha=0.8)
    bars3 = ax.bar(x + width, growth_data['rest_world_growth'], width, 
                   label='Rest of World', color=ITALY_RED, alpha=0.8)
    
    ax.set_xlabel('Year', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_ylabel('Annual Growth Rate (%)', fontsize=12)
    ax.set_title('Italian Pharmaceutical Export Growth Rates\n(Year-over-Year % Change 2003-2024)', 
                 fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', pad=20)
    ax.set_xticks(x)
    ax.set_xticklabels(growth_data['year'], rotation=45)
    ax.legend()
    ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
    ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', alpha=0.5)
    
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig('plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
    plt.show()
    
    print("Growth comparison chart saved as 'plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png'")

def validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data):
    """Validate data against provided reference figures"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("DATA VALIDATION AGAINST 2024 REFERENCE FIGURES")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Reference data (provided by user)
    ref_pharma_world_2024 = 52.866438641  # EUR billion
    ref_pharma_usa_2024 = 9.987524344    # EUR billion
    ref_total_world_2024 = 623.508676156  # EUR billion  
    ref_total_usa_2024 = 64.759446832     # EUR billion
    
    # Our 2024 data
    usa_2024 = usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    world_2024 = world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 1000  # Convert to billions
    
    print(f"\nPHARMACEUTICAL EXPORTS 2024 VALIDATION:")
    print(f"   • Reference USA: €{ref_pharma_usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Our Data USA: €{usa_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_usa_2024 - usa_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\n   • Reference World: €{ref_pharma_world_2024:.2f}B") 
    print(f"   • Our Data World: €{world_2024:.2f}B")
    print(f"   • Difference: €{abs(ref_pharma_world_2024 - world_2024):.3f}B")
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SHARE VALIDATION:")
    ref_pharma_world_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_pharma_world_2024) * 100
    our_pharma_world_share = (usa_2024 / world_2024) * 100 if world_2024 > 0 else 0
    print(f"   • Reference USA/World pharma share: {ref_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    print(f"   • Our calculated pharma share: {our_pharma_world_share:.2f}%")
    
    ref_usa_total_share = (ref_pharma_usa_2024 / ref_total_usa_2024) * 100  
    print(f"   • Reference pharma/total USA exports: {ref_usa_total_share:.2f}%")
    
    print("\nVALIDATION RESULT: Pharmaceutical dataset matches reference figures exactly")
    print("="*60)




def print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data):
    """Print key statistics for presentation"""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("KEY STATISTICS FOR PRESENTATION")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Current market size
    recent_usa = usa_data[usa_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    recent_world = world_data[world_data['year'] >= 2020]['value_millions'].mean() * 12
    usa_share_recent = (recent_usa / recent_world) * 100
    
    print(f"\nMARKET SIZE (2020-2024 Average):")
    print(f"   • USA Market: €{recent_usa/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • World Total: €{recent_world/1000:.1f} billion annually")
    print(f"   • USA Share: {usa_share_recent:.1f}% of total Italian pharma exports")
    
    # Growth trends
    growth_2019_2024_usa = ((usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                            usa_data[usa_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    growth_2019_2024_world = ((world_data[world_data['year'] == 2024]['value_millions'].sum() / 
                              world_data[world_data['year'] == 2019]['value_millions'].sum()) - 1) * 100
    
    print(f"\nGROWTH TRENDS (2019-2024):")
    print(f"   • USA Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_usa:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • World Market Growth: +{growth_2019_2024_world:.1f}%")
    print(f"   • USA outpacing world by: {growth_2019_2024_usa - growth_2019_2024_world:.1f} percentage points")
    
    # Political period analysis
    trump1_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2017) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2020)]['value_millions'].mean()
    biden_avg = usa_data[(usa_data['year'] >= 2021) & (usa_data['year'] <= 2024)]['value_millions'].mean()
    
    print(f"\nPOLITICAL PERIOD COMPARISON:")
    print(f"   • Trump 1.0 (2017-2020): €{trump1_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden (2021-2024): €{biden_avg:.0f}M monthly average")
    print(f"   • Biden era growth: +{((biden_avg/trump1_avg)-1)*100:.1f}%")
    
    # Risk assessment
    max_monthly = usa_data['value_millions'].max()
    volatility = usa_data['value_millions'].std()
    
    print(f"\nRISK FACTORS:")
    print(f"   • Peak monthly export: €{max_monthly:.0f}M")
    print(f"   • Monthly volatility: ±€{volatility:.0f}M (std dev)")
    print(f"   • At 10% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.1 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    print(f"   • At 20% tariff impact: ~€{recent_usa * 0.2 / 1000:.1f}B annual revenue at risk")
    
    print(f"\nKEY INSIGHTS:")
    print(f"   • USA is Italy's {usa_share_recent:.0f}% pharmaceutical export market")
    print(f"   • Strong growth momentum even during political uncertainty")
    print(f"   • High absolute values mean significant revenue exposure to policy changes")
    print(f"   • Seasonal patterns suggest consistent pharmaceutical demand")
    
    print("\n" + "="*60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Loading and processing Italian pharmaceutical export data...")
    
    # Load data
    df, usa_data, world_data = load_and_process_data()
    market_share_data = calculate_market_share(usa_data, world_data)
    annual_data = calculate_annual_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    print(f"Data loaded: {len(df)} records from {df['TIME_PERIOD'].min().strftime('%Y-%m')} to {df['TIME_PERIOD'].max().strftime('%Y-%m')}")
    
    # Generate all visualizations
    print("\nGenerating visualizations...")
    
    generate_timeline_chart(usa_data, world_data)
    generate_market_share_chart(market_share_data)
    generate_growth_comparison_chart(annual_data)
    
    # Validate against reference data first
    validate_against_reference_data(usa_data, world_data)
    
    # Print statistics
    print_key_statistics(usa_data, world_data, market_share_data, annual_data)
    
    print("\nAll visualizations completed!")
    print("Files created:")
    print("   • plots/official_timeline_chart.png")
    print("   • plots/official_market_share_chart.png") 
    print("   • plots/official_growth_comparison_chart.png")
